24.lv: 31 Un viņš sacīja, Nāc iekšā tu, no tā KUNGA svētītais; kādēļ tu stāvi ārpusē? jo es esmu sagatavojis namu un telpu kamieļiem.

24.en: 32And the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.
24.lv:
32

Un vīrietis nāca namā: un viņš atjoza savus kamieļus un deva salmus un lopbarību kamieļiem, un ūdeni mazgāt viņa kājas, un vīriešu kājas, kas bija kopā ar viņu.

24.en: 33And there was set meat before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.
24.lv: 33 Un viņa priekšā tika likta barība, ko ēst: bet viņš sacīja, Es neēdīšu, līdz es neesmu stāstījis savu vēstījumu. Un viņš sacīja, Runā nu.

24.en: 34And he said, I am Abraham's servant.
24.lv: 34 Un viņš sacīja, Es esmu Ābrahāma kalps.

24.en: 35And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.
24.lv: 35 Un tas KUNGS ir ļoti svētījis manu saimnieku; un viņš ir kļuvis liels: un viņš ir devis viņam sīklopus un liellopus, un sudrabu, un zeltu, un kalpus, un kalpones, un kamieļus, un ēzeļus.

24.en: 36And Sarah my master's wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
24.lv: 36 Un Sāra, mana saimnieka sieva, dzemdēja manam saimniekam dēlu, kad viņa bija veca: un viņam viņš ir devis visu, kas viņam ir.

24.en: 37And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
24.lv: 37 Un mans saimnieks man lika zvērēt sacīdams, Tev nebūs ņemt sievu manam dēlam no kanaāniešu meitām, kuru zemē es mājoju:

24.en: 38But thou shalt go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
24.lv: 38 Bet tev būs iet uz mana tēva namu un pie maniem radiem un ņemt sievu manam dēlam.

24.en: 39And I said unto my master, Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
24.lv: 39 Un es sacīju savam saimniekam, Ja nu gadījumā tā sieviete man negribēs sekot.

24.en: 40And he said unto me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house:
24.lv: 40 Un viņš man sacīja, Tas KUNGS, kura priekšā es staigāju, sūtīs savu eņģeli ar tevi un liks sekmēties tavam ceļam; un tev būs ņemt sievu manam dēlam no maniem radiem un no mana tēva nama:

24.en: 41Then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
24.lv: 41 Tad tu būsi brīvs no šī mana zvēresta, kad tu nāc pie maniem radiem; un, ja tie tev nedod kādu, tad tu būsi brīvs no mana zvēresta.

24.en: 42And I came this day unto the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go:
24.lv: 42 Un es nācu šajā dienā pie akas un sacīju, Ak, KUNGS, mana saimnieka Ābrahāma Dievs, ja tu tagad liec sekmēties manam ceļam, ko es eju:

24.en: 43Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
24.lv: 43 Lūk, es stāvu pie ūdens akas; un notiks, ka, kad jaunava iznāk smelt ūdeni, un es viņai saku, Dod man, es tevi lūdzu, nedaudz ūdens no savas krūkas dzert;

24.en: 44And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath appointed out for my master's son.
24.lv: 44 Un viņa man saka, Dzer gan tu, gan es arī smelšu taviem kamieļiem: lai tā pati ir sieviete, kuru tas KUNGS ir noteicis mana saimnieka dēlam.

24.en: 45And before I had done speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
24.lv: 45 Un pirms es biju beidzis runāšanu savā sirdī, lūk, Rebeka iznāca ar savu krūku uz sava pleca; un viņa nogāja pie akas un smēla ūdeni: un es viņai sacīju, Ļauj man dzert, es tevi lūdzu.

24.en: 46And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
24.lv: 46 Un viņa steidzās un nolaida lejā savu krūku no sava pleca un sacīja, Dzer, un es došu arī taviem kamieļiem dzert: tā es dzēru, un viņa lika arī kamieļiem dzert.

24.en: 47And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
24.lv: 47 Un es viņai jautāju un sacīju, Kā meita tu esi? Un viņa sacīja, Betuēla, Nahora dēla, kuru Milka viņam dzemdēja, meita: un es liku auskaru uz viņas sejas un rokassprādzes uz viņas rokām.

24.en: 48And I bowed down my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter unto his son.
24.lv: 48 Un es noliecu savu galvu un godināju to KUNGU, un svētīju to KUNGU, sava saimnieka Ābrahāma Dievu, kas bija mani vadījis pareizā ceļā ņemt mana saimnieka brāļa meitu viņa dēlam.

24.en: 49And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
24.lv: 49 Un nu, ja jūs izturēsieties laipni un patiesi pret manu saimnieku, stāstiet man: un, ja nē, stāstiet man; lai es varu griezties pa labo roku vai pa kreiso.

24.en: 50Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
24.lv:
50

Tad Lābans un Betuēls atbildēja un sacīja, Tā lieta iznāk no tā KUNGA: mēs neveram tev runāt sliktu vai labu.

24.en: 51Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the LORD hath spoken.
24.lv: 51 Lūk, Rebeka ir tavā priekšā, ņem viņu un ej, un lai viņa ir tava saimnieka dēla sieva, kā tas KUNGS ir runājis.

24.en: 52And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.
24.lv: 52 Un notika, ka, kad Ābrahāma kalps bija dzirdējis viņu vārdus, viņš godināja to KUNGU, klanīdamies līdz zemei.

24.en: 53And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
24.lv: 53 Un kalps iznesa sudraba dārglietas un zelta dārglietas, un tērpu, un deva tos Rebekai: viņš deva arī dārgas lietas viņas brālim un viņas mātei.

24.en: 54And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.
24.lv: 54 Un tie ēda un dzēra, viņš un vīrieši, kas bija kopā ar viņu, un uzkavējās visu nakti; un tie cēlās no rīta, un viņš sacīja, Sūtiet mani prom pie mana saimnieka.

24.en: 55And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
24.lv: 55 Un viņas brālis un viņas māte sacīja, Lai meitene paliek ar mums nedaudz dienas, vismaz desmit; pēc tam viņa ies.

24.en: 56And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
24.lv: 56 Un viņš tiem sacīja, Nekavējiet mani, jo tas KUNGS ir licis manam ceļam sekmēties; sūtiet mani prom, lai es varu iet pie sava saimnieka.

24.en: 57And they said, We will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.
24.lv: 57 Un tie sacīja, Mēs aicināsim meiteni un jautāsim no viņas mutes.

24.en: 58And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
24.lv: 58 Un tie aicināja Rebeku un viņai sacīja, Vai tu iesi ar šo vīrieti? Un viņa sacīja, Es iešu.

24.en: 59And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.
24.lv: 59 Un tie sūtīja prom Rebeku, savu māsu, un viņas zīdītāju, un Ābrahāma kalpu, un viņa vīriešus.

24.en: 60And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
24.lv: 60 Un tie svētīja Rebeku un viņai sacīja, Tu esi mūsu māsa, esi miljonu tūkstošu māte, un lai tava sēkla iemanto to vārtus, kas tos ienīst.

24.en: 61And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
24.lv:
61

Un Rebeka cēlās, un viņas meitenes, un tās jāja uz kamieļiem un sekoja tam vīrietim: un kalps ņēma Rebeku un aizgāja.

24.en: 62 And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.
24.lv: 62 Un Īzaks nāca no akas Lahaj-roi ceļa; jo viņš mājoja dienvidu zemē.

24.en: 63 And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.
24.lv: 63 Un Īzaks izgāja laukā meditēt novakarē: un viņš pacēla savas acis un redzēja, un lūk, kamieļi nāca.

24.en: 64And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted off the camel.
24.lv: 64 Un Rebeka pacēla savas acis, un, kad viņa redzēja Īzaku, viņa nolaidās no kamieļa.

24.en: 65For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.
24.lv: 65 Jo viņa bija sacījusi kalpam, Kas ir šis vīrietis, kas staigā laukā mūs satikt? Un kalps bija sacījis, Tas ir mans saimnieks: tāpēc viņa ņēma apsegu un apsedzās.

24.en: 66And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
24.lv: 66 Un kalps stāstīja Īzakam visu, ko viņš bija darījis.

24.en: 67And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
24.lv: 67 Un Īzaks viņu ieveda savas mātes Sāras teltī, un ņēma Rebeku, un viņa kļuva par viņa sievu; un viņš to mīlēja: un Īzaks tika mierināts pēc savas mātes nāves.

25.en: 1Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
25.lv: 1 Tad Ābrahāms atkal ņēma sievu, un viņas vārds bija Ketūra.

25.en: 2And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
25.lv: 2 Un tā viņam dzemdēja Zimrānu un Jokšānu, un Medānu, un Midiānu, un Jišbāku, un Šuahu.

25.en: 3And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
25.lv: 3 Un Jokšāns dzemdināja Šebu un Dedānu. Un Dedāna dēli bija Ašūrīms un Letušīms, un Leūmīms.

25.en: 4And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
25.lv: 4 Un Midiāna dēli; Ēfa un Ēfers, un Hanohs, un Abida, un Eldāa. Visi šie bija Ketūras bērni.

25.en: 5And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
25.lv:
5

Un Ābrahāms visu, kas viņam bija, deva Īzakam.

25.en: 6But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
25.lv: 6 Bet konkubīņu dēliem, kas Ābrahāmam bija, Ābrahāms deva dāvanas un sūtīja tos prom no Īzaka, sava dēla, kamēr viņš vēl dzīvoja, uz austrumiem, uz austrumu zemi.

25.en: 7And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
25.lv: 7 Un šīs ir Ābrahāma dzīvības gadu dienas, ko viņš dzīvoja, simts septiņdesmit pieci gadi.

25.en: 8Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
25.lv: 8 Tad Ābrahāms atdeva garu un nomira labā vecumā, vecs vīrietis un pilns gadu; un tika piepulcināts saviem ļaudīm.

25.en: 9And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;
25.lv: 9 Un viņa dēli Īzaks un Išmaēls viņu apbedīja Mahpelā alā, Efrona, hētieša, Coēra dēla, laukā, kas ir pirms Mamres;

25.en: 10The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
25.lv: 10 Laukā, ko Ābrahāms nopirka no Hēta dēliem: tur tika apbedīts Ābrahāms un Sāra, viņa sieva.

25.en: 11And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahairoi.
25.lv:
11

Un pēc Ābrahāma nāves notika, ka Dievs svētīja viņa dēlu Īzaku; un Īzaks mājoja pie Lahoj-roi akas.

25.en: 12Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bare unto Abraham:
25.lv:
12

Tad nu šīs ir Ismaēla, Ābrahāma dēla, paaudzes, ko ēģiptiete Hagare, Sāras kalpone, dzemdēja Ābrahāmam:

25.en: 13And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebajoth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
25.lv: 13 Un šie ir Ismaēla dēlu vārdi pēc viņu vārdiem atbilstoši savām paaudzēm: Ismaēla pirmdzimtais Nebājots; un Kēdars, un Adbeēls, un Mibsāms,

25.en: 14And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
25.lv: 14 Un Mišma, un Dūma, un Masa,

25.en: 15Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
25.lv: 15 Hadads, un Tēma, Jetūrs, Nafīšs un Kēdema:

25.en: 16These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.
25.lv: 16 Šie ir Ismaēla dēli, un šie ir viņu vārdi, pēc viņu miestiem un pēc viņu pilīm; divpadsmit prinči atbilstoši viņu tautām.

25.en: 17And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was gathered unto his people.
25.lv: 17 Un šie ir Ismaēla dzīvības gadi, simts trīsdesmit septiņi gadi: un viņš atdeva garu un nomira; un tika piepulcināts saviem ļaudīm.

25.en: 18And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.
25.lv: 18 Un tie mājoja no Havīlas līdz Šūrai, kas ir Ēģiptes priekšā, ejot uz Asīriju: un viņš nomira visu savu brāļu klātbūtnē.

25.en: 19And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begat Isaac:
25.lv:
19

Un šīs ir Īzaka, Ābrahāma dēla, paaudzes: Ābrahāms dzemdināja Īzaku:

25.en: 20And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
25.lv: 20 Un Īzaks bija četrdesmit gadu vecs, kad viņš ņēma Rebeku, Padān-aramas sīrieša Betuēla meitu, sīrieša Lābana māsu, par sievu.

25.en: 21And Isaac intreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
25.lv: 21 Un Īzaks lūdzās to KUNGU par savu sievu, tāpēc ka viņa bija neauglīga: un tas KUNGS ļāvās pielūgties no viņa, un viņa sieva Rebeka kļuva grūta.

25.en: 22And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.
25.lv: 22 Un bērni cīnījās viņā; un viņa sacīja, Ja ir tā, kāpēc es esmu tāda? Un viņa gāja jautāt no tā KUNGA.

25.en: 23And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
25.lv: 23 Un tas KUNGS viņai sacīja, Divas tautas ir tavā klēpī, un divējādi ļaudis tiks nošķirti no tavām iekšām; un vieni ļaudis būs stiprāki par otriem ļaudīm; un vecākais kalpos jaunākajam.

25.en: 24And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
25.lv:
24

Un, kad viņas dienas dzemdēt bija piepildītas, lūk, viņas klēpī bija dvīņi.

25.en: 25And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
25.lv: 25 Un pirmais iznāca sarkans, viscaur kā matains apģērbs; un tie nosauca viņa vārdu Ēsavs.

25.en: 26And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
25.lv: 26 Un pēc tam iznāca viņa brālis, un viņa roka satvēra Ēsava papēdi; un viņa vārds tika nosaukts Jēkabs: un Īzaks bija sešdesmit gadu vecs, kad viņa tos dzemdēja.

25.en: 27And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.
25.lv: 27 Un puiši auga: un Ēsavs bija izveicīgs mednieks, lauka vīrietis: un Jēkabs bija vienkāršs vīrietis, mājodams teltīs.

25.en: 28And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.
25.lv: 28 Un Īzaks mīlēja Ēsavu, tāpēc ka viņš ēda no viņa medījuma: bet Rebeka mīlēja Jēkabu.

25.en: 29And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:
25.lv:
29

Un Jēkabs vārīja viru: un Ēsavs nāca no lauka, un viņš bija noguris:

25.en: 30And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
25.lv: 30 Un Ēsavs Jēkabam sacīja, Pabaro mani, es tevi lūdzu, ar to pašu sarkano viru; jo es esmu noguris: tāpēc viņa vārds tika saukts Edoms.

25.en: 31And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.
25.lv: 31 Un Jēkabs sacīja, Pārdod man šajā dienā savas pirmdzimtības tiesības.

25.en: 32And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
25.lv: 32 Un Ēsavs sacīja, Lūk, es esmu pie miršanas: un kādu labumu man šīs pirmdzimtības tiesības dos?

25.en: 33And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
25.lv: 33 Un Jēkabs sacīja, Zvērē man šajā dienā; un viņš tam zvērēja: un viņš pārdeva savas pirmdzimtības tiesības Jēkabam.

25.en: 34Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.
25.lv: 34 Tad Jēkabs deva Ēsavam maizi un lēcu viru; un viņš ēda un dzēra, un piecēlās, un aizgāja: tā Ēsavs nicināja savas pirmdzimtības tiesības.

26.en: 1And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.
26.lv: 1 Un zemē bija bads līdzās pirmajam badam, kas bija Ābrahāma dienās. Un Īzaks gāja pie filistiešu ķēniņa Abimeleha uz Gerāru.

26.en: 2And the LORD appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:
26.lv: 2 Un tas KUNGS viņam parādījās un sacīja, Nenoej uz Ēģipti; mājo zemē, par kuru es tev stāstīšu:

26.en: 3Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;
26.lv: 3 Piedzīvo šajā zemē, un es būšu ar tevi un tevi svētīšu; jo tev un tavai sēklai es došu visas šīs zemes, un es izpildīšu zvērestu, ko es zvērēju tavam tēvam Ābrahāmam;

26.en: 4And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
26.lv: 4 Un es likšu tavai sēklai vairoties kā debess zvaigznēm un došu tavai sēklai visas šīs zemes; un tavā sēklā visas zemes tautas tiks svētītas;

26.en: 5Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
26.lv: 5 Tāpēc ka Ābrahāms paklausīja manu balsi un turēja manu uzdevumu, manas pavēles, manus statūtus un manus likumus.

26.en: 6And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
26.lv:
6

Un Īzaks mājoja Gerārā:

26.en: 7And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
26.lv: 7 Un tās vietas vīrieši viņam prasīja par viņa sievu; un viņš sacīja, Viņa ir mana māsa: jo viņš bijās sacīt, Viņa ir mana sieva; lai, viņš sacīja, tās vietas vīrieši mani nenogalinātu Rebekas dēļ; tāpēc ka viņa bija glīta pēc izskata.

26.en: 8And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
26.lv: 8 Un notika, kad viņš bija tur ilgu laiku, ka filistiešu ķēniņš Abimelehs lūkojās ārā pa logu un redzēja, un, lūk, Īzaks amizējās ar savu sievu Rebeku.

26.en: 9And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die for her.
26.lv: 9 Un Abimelehs aicināja Īzaku un sacīja, Lūk, bez šaubām, viņa ir tava sieva: un kā tu sacīji, Viņa ir mana māsa? Un Īzaks viņam sacīja, Tāpēc ka es sacīju, Lai es nemirstu viņas dēļ.

26.en: 10And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.
26.lv: 10 Un Abimelehs sacīja, Kas ir šis, ko tu mums esi darījis? viens no ļaudīm varētu būt viegli gulējis ar tavu sievu, un tu mums būtu uzvedis vainīgumu.

26.en: 11And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
26.lv: 11 Un Abimelehs piekodināja visus savus ļaudis sacīdams, Tas, kas aizskar šo vīrieti vai viņa sievu, bez šaubām tiks nonāvēts.

26.en: 12Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the LORD blessed him.
26.lv: 12 Tad Īzaks sēja tajā zemē un tajā pašā gadā saņēma simtkārtīgi: un tas KUNGS viņu svētīja.

26.en: 13And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
26.lv: 13 Un tas vīrietis kļuva liels un devās uz priekšu, un auga līdz viņš kļuva ļoti liels:

26.en: 14For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the Philistines envied him.
26.lv: 14 Jo viņam bija sīklopu īpašums un liellopu īpašums, un liels kalpu krājums: un filistieši viņu apskauda.

26.en: 15For all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
26.lv: 15 Jo visas akas, ko viņa tēva kalpi bija rakuši viņa tēva Ābrahāma dienās, filistieši bija tās aizbāzuši un pildījuši tās ar zemi.

26.en: 16And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
26.lv: 16 Un Abimelehs Īzakam sacīja, Ej no mums; jo tu esi daudz varenāks par mums.

26.en: 17And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
26.lv:
17

Un Īzaks aizgāja no turienes un uzslēja savu telti Gerāra ielejā, un mājoja tur.

26.en: 18And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
26.lv: 18 Un Īzaks raka atkal ūdens akas, ko tie bija rakuši viņa tēva Ābrahāma dienās; jo filistieši tās bija aizbāzuši pēc Ābrahāma nāves: un viņš nosauca to vārdus pēc vārdiem, ar ko viņa tēvs tās bija nosaucis.

26.en: 19And Isaac's servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
26.lv: 19 Un Īzaka kalpi raka ielejā un atrada mutuļojoša ūdens aku.

26.en: 20And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac's herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.
26.lv: 20 Un Gerāra gani strīdējās ar Īzaka ganiem sacīdami, Ūdens ir mūsu: un viņš nosauca akas vārdu Ēseka; tāpēc ka tie strīdējās ar viņu.

26.en: 21And they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
26.lv: 21 Un tie raka citu aku un strīdējās arī par to: un viņš nosauca tās vārdu Sitna.

26.en: 22And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the LORD hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
26.lv: 22 Un viņš nocēlās no turienes un raka citu aku; un par to viņi nestrīdējās: un viņš nosauca tās vārdu Rehobota; un viņš sacīja, Jo nu tas KUNGS ir taisījis mums vietu, un mēs augļosimies zemē.

26.en: 23And he went up from thence to Beersheba.
26.lv:
23

Un viņš devās no turienes uz Bēr-šebu.

26.en: 24And the LORD appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham's sake.
26.lv: 24 Un tas KUNGS viņam parādījās tajā naktī un sacīja, Es esmu tava tēva Ābrahāma Dievs: nebīsties, jo es esmu ar tevi un tevi svētīšu, un vairošu tavu sēklu sava kalpa Ābrahāma dēļ.

26.en: 25And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the LORD, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaac's servants digged a well.
26.lv: 25 Un viņš tur uzbūvēja altāri un sauca uz tā KUNGA vārdu, un uzslēja tur savu telti: un tur Īzaka kalpi raka aku.

26.en: 26Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.
26.lv:
26

Tad Abimelehs nāca pie viņa no Gerarās, un Ahuzats, viens no viņa draugiem, un Pihols, viņa armijas galvenais kapteinis.

26.en: 27And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
26.lv: 27 Un Īzaks tiem sacīja, Kādēļ jūs nākat pie manis, ja jūs mani ienīstat un esat mani sūtījuši prom no jums?

26.en: 28And they said, We saw certainly that the LORD was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
26.lv: 28 Un tie sacīja, Mēs noteikti redzējām, ka tas KUNGS bija ar tevi: un mēs sacījām, Lai starp mums nu ir zvērests, proti, starp mums un tevi, un lai slēdzam ar tevi derību;

26.en: 29That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the LORD.
26.lv: 29 Lai tu mums nedari nekādu kaitējumu, kā mēs tevi neesam aizskāruši, un kā mēs neesam darījuši tev neko, kā tikai labu, un esam sūtījuši tevi prom mierā: nu tu esi svētītais no tā KUNGA.

26.en: 30And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
26.lv: 30 Un viņš tiem taisīja dzīres, un tie ēda un dzēra.

26.en: 31And they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
26.lv: 31 Un tie cēlās laikus no rīta un zvērēja viens otram: un Īzaks tos sūtīja prom, un tie aizgāja no viņa mierā.

26.en: 32And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, We have found water.
26.lv: 32 Un tajā dienā notika, ka Īzaka kalpi nāca un stāstīja viņam attiecībā uz aku, ko tie bija rakuši, un viņam sacīja, Mēs esam atraduši ūdeni.

26.en: 33And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.
26.lv: 33 Un viņš nosauca to Šeba: tāpēc pilsētas vārds ir Bēr-šeba līdz šai dienai.

26.en: 34And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:
26.lv:
34

Un Ēsavs bija četrdesmit gadu vecs, kad viņš ņēma par sievu Judīti, hetieša Beērija, meitu, un Bāsmati, hetieša Ēlona, meitu:

26.en: 35Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
26.lv: 35 Kas bija prāta skumjas Īzakam un Rebekai.

27.en: 1 And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.
27.lv: 1 Un notika, ka, kad Īzaks bija vecs un viņa acis bija blāvas, tā ka viņš nevarēja redzēt, viņš aicināja Ēsavu, savu vecāko dēlu, un viņam sacīja, Mans dēls: un tas viņam sacīja, Lūk, šeit es esmu.

27.en: 2 And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:
27.lv: 2 Un viņš sacīja, Lūk, nu es esmu vecs, es nezinu savas nāves dienu:

27.en: 3 Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
27.lv: 3 Tāpēc nu, ņem, es tevi lūdzu, savus ieročus, savu bultu maku un savu loku, un izej laukā un ņem man kādu medījumu;

27.en: 4 And make me savoury meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
27.lv: 4 Un taisi man pikantu barību, tādu, kā es mīlu, un nes man to, lai es varu ēst; lai mana dvēsele tevi var svētīt pirms es mirstu.

27.en: 5And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
27.lv: 5 Un Rebeka dzirdēja, kad Īzaks runāja uz savu dēlu Ēsavu. Un Ēsavs gāja uz lauku medīt medījumu un to atnest.

27.en: 6And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,
27.lv:
6

Un Rebeka runāja uz savu dēlu Jēkabu sacīdama, Lūk, es dzirdēju tavu tēvu runājam uz tavu brāli Ēsavu sakām,

27.en: 7Bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the LORD before my death.
27.lv: 7 Atnes man medījumu un taisi man pikantu barību, lai es varu ēst un tevi svētīt tā KUNGA priekšā pirms savas nāves.

27.en: 8Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.
27.lv: 8 Tāpēc nu, mans dēls, paklausi manu balsi atbilstoši tam, ko es tev pavēlu.

27.en: 9Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
27.lv: 9 Ej nu uz ganāmpulku un ņem man no turienes divus labus kazlēnus no kazām; un es [no] tiem taisīšu pikantu barību tavam tēvam, tādu, kā viņš mīl:

27.en: 10And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
27.lv: 10 Un tu to nesīsi savam tēvam, lai viņš var ēst un lai viņš tevi var svētīt pirms savas nāves.

27.en: 11And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:
27.lv: 11 Un Jēkabs sacīja savai mātei Rebekai, Mans brālis Ēsavs ir matains vīrietis, un es esmu gluds vīrietis:

27.en: 12My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
27.lv: 12 Ja nu gadījumā mans tēvs mani pataustīs, un es viņam šķitīšu kā viltnieks; un es uz sevi vedīšu lāstu un ne svētību.

27.en: 13And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
27.lv: 13 Un viņa māte viņam sacīja, Uz mani lai ir tavs lāsts, mans dēls: tikai paklausi manu balsi un ej, atnes man tos.

27.en: 14And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.
27.lv: 14 Un viņš gāja un atnesa, un nesa tos savai mātei: un viņa māte taisīja pikantu barību, tādu, kā viņa tēvs mīlēja.

27.en: 15And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son:
27.lv: 15 Un Rebeka ņēma glītu, sava vecākā dēla Ēsava, tērpu, kas bija ar viņu namā, un vilka to uz sava jaunākā dēla Jēkaba:

27.en: 16And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
27.lv: 16 Un viņa lika kazu kazlēnu ādas uz viņa rokām un uz viņa kakla gluduma:

27.en: 17And she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
27.lv: 17 Un viņa deva sava dēla Jēkaba rokā pikantu barību un maizi, ko viņa bija sagatavojusi.

27.en: 18And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
27.lv:
18

Un viņš nāca pie sava tēva un sacīja, Mans tēvs: un viņš sacīja, Šeit es esmu; kas tu esi, mans dēls?

27.en: 19And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy firstborn; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
27.lv: 19 Un Jēkabs sacīja savam tēvam, Es esmu Ēsavs, tavs pirmdzimtais; es esmu darījis atbilstoši tam, kā tu man vēlēji; celies, es tevi lūdzu, sēdi un ēd no mana medījuma, lai tava dvēsele mani var svētīt.

27.en: 20And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the LORD thy God brought it to me.
27.lv: 20 Un Īzaks sacīja savam dēlam, Kā tas ir, ka tu to esi tik drīz atradis, mans dēls? Un viņš sacīja, Tāpēc ka tas KUNGS, tavs Dievs, to man ir atvedis.

27.en: 21And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.
27.lv: 21 Un Īzaks sacīja Jēkabam, Nāc tuvu, es tevi lūdzu, lai es tevi varu pataustīt, mans dēls, vai tu esi mans paša dēls Esavs vai nē.

27.en: 22And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
27.lv: 22 Un Jēkabs gāja tuvu savam tēvam Īzakam; un viņš to taustīja un sacīja, Balss ir Jēkaba balss, bet rokas ir Ēsava rokas.

27.en: 23And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands: so he blessed him.
27.lv: 23 Un viņš to neizšķīra, tāpēc ka viņa rokas bija ļoti matainas, kā viņa brāļa Ēsava rokas: tā viņš to svētīja.

27.en: 24And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
27.lv: 24 Un viņš sacīja, Vai tu esi mans paša dēls Ēsavs? Un viņš sacīja, Es esmu.

27.en: 25And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
27.lv: 25 Un viņš sacīja, Nes to man tuvu, un es ēdīšu no sava dēla medījuma, lai mana dvēsele tevi var svētīt. Un viņš nesa to viņam tuvu, un viņš ēda: un viņš nesa viņam vīnu, un viņš dzēra.

27.en: 26And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
27.lv: 26 Un viņa tēvs Īzaks viņam sacīja, Nāc nu tuvu un skūpsti mani, mans dēls.

27.en: 27And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD hath blessed:
27.lv: 27 Un viņš nāca tuvu un skūpstīja viņu: un viņš saoda viņa tērpa smaržu un svētīja viņu, un sacīja, Redzi, mana dēla smarža ir kā lauka smarža, ko tas KUNGS ir svētījis:

27.en: 28Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
27.lv: 28 Tāpēc Dievs lai tev dod no debess rasas un zemes treknuma, un bagātīgi no labības un vīna:

27.en: 29Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
27.lv: 29 Lai ļaudis tev kalpo un tautas tev klanās: esi kungs pār saviem brāļiem, un lai tavas mātes dēli tev klanās: nolādēts ir ikviens, kas tevi nolād, un svētīts ir tas, kas tevi svētī.

27.en: 30 And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
27.lv:
30

Un notika, tiklīdz Īzaks bija beidzis svētīt Jēkabu, un Jēkabs bija tikko izgājis no Īzaka, sava tēva, klātbūtnes, ka Ēsavs, viņa brālis, ienāca no savām medībām.

27.en: 31 And he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.
27.lv: 31 Un viņš arī bija taisījis pikantu barību un nesa to savam tēvam, un sacīja savam tēvam, Lai mans tēvs pieceļas, un ēd no sava dēla medījuma, lai tava dvēsele var mani svētīt.

27.en: 32 And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy firstborn Esau.
27.lv: 32 Un Īzaks, viņa tēvs, viņam sacīja, Kas tu esi? Un viņš sacīja, Es esmu tavs dēls, tavs pirmdzimtais Ēsavs.

27.en: 33 And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
27.lv: 33 Un Īzaks ļoti drebēja un sacīja, Kas? kur ir tas, kas bija ņēmis medījumu un to nesis man, un es esmu ēdis no visa pirms tu nāci, un esmu viņu svētījis? jā, un viņš būs svētīts.

27.en: 34 And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.
27.lv:
34

Un, kad Ēsavs dzirdēja sava tēva vārdus, viņš sauca ar lielu un ārkārtīgi rūgtu saucienu, un sacīja savam tēvam, Svētī mani, arī mani, ak, mans tēvs.

27.en: 35 And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
27.lv: 35 Un viņš sacīja, Tavs brālis nāca ar izmanību un ir atņēmis tavu svētību.

27.en: 36 And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
27.lv: 36 Un viņš sacīja, Vai viņš netiek pareizi saukts Jēkabs? jo viņš mani ir piekrāpis šīs divas reizes: viņš atņēma manas pirmdzimtības tiesības; un, lūk, nu viņš ir atņēmis manu svētību. Un viņš sacīja, Vai tu neesi pataupījis svētību priekš manis?

27.en: 37 And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son?
27.lv: 37 Un Īzaks atbildēja un sacīja Ēsavam, Lūk, es viņu esmu iecēlis par tavu kungu, un visus viņa brāļus es esmu devis viņam par kalpiem; un ar labību un vīnu es viņu esmu uzturējis: un ko es nu darīšu tev, mans dēls?

27.en: 38 And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
27.lv: 38 Un Ēsavs sacīja savam tēvam, Vai tev ir tikai viena svētība, mans tēvs? svētī mani, arī mani, ak, mans tēvs. Un Ēsavs pacēla savu balsi un raudāja.

27.en: 39And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;
27.lv: 39 Un viņa tēvs Īzaks atbildēja un viņam sacīja, Lūk, tava mājvieta būs zemes treknums un no debess rasas no augšas;

27.en: 40And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
27.lv: 40 Un no zobena tu dzīvosi un kalposi savam brālim; un notiks, kad tu valdīsi, ka tu nolauzīsi viņa jūgu no sava kakla.

27.en: 41And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
27.lv:
41

Un Ēsavs ienīda Jēkabu svētības dēļ, ar ko viņa tēvs viņu svētīja: un Ēsavs sacīja savā sirdī, Sēru dienas manam tēvam ir tuvu klāt; tad es nokaušu savu brāli Jēkabu.

27.en: 42And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
27.lv:
42

Un šie Ēsava, viņas vecākā dēla, vārdi tika stāstīti Rebekai: un viņa sūtīja un aicināja Jēkabu, savu jaunāko dēlu, un viņam sacīja, Lūk, tavs brālis Ēsavs, kas attiecas uz tevi, mierina sevi, nodomādams tevi nogalināt.

27.en: 43Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
27.lv: 43 Tad nu tāpēc, mans dēls, paklausi manu balsi; un celies, bēdz pie mana brāļa Lābana uz Hārānu;

27.en: 44And tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away;
27.lv: 44 Un uzkavējies pie viņa nedaudz dienas, līdz tava brāļa niknums novēršas;

27.en: 45Until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?
27.lv: 45 Līdz tava brāļa dusmas novēršas no tevis un viņš aizmirst to, ko tu viņam esi izdarījis: tad es sūtīšu un atvedīšu tevi no turienes: kāpēc lai man tiktu atņemti jūs abi vienā dienā?

27.en: 46And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
27.lv: 46 Un Rebeka sacīja Īzakam, Es esmu piekususi par savu dzīvību Heta meitu dēļ: ja Jēkabs ņem sievu no heta meitām tādas, kā šīs, kas ir tās zemes meitas, ko labu mana dzīvība man darīs?

28.en: 1And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
28.lv: 1 Un Īzaks aicināja Jēkabu un viņu svētīja, un viņam piekodināja, un viņam sacīja, Tev nebūs ņemt sievu no Kanaāna meitām.

28.en: 2Arise, go to Padanaram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother's father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother's brother.
28.lv: 2 Celies, ej uz Padān-aramu, uz Betuēla, tavas mātes tēva, namu; un ņem sev sievu no turienes, no tavas mātes brāļa Lābana meitām.

28.en: 3And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
28.lv: 3 Un Visvarenais Dievs lai tevi svētī un liek tev augļoties un tevi vairo, lai tu vari būt ļaužu pūlis;

28.en: 4And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
28.lv: 4 Un lai tev dod Ābrahāma svētību, tev un tavai sēklai līdz ar tevi; lai tu vari iemantot zemi, kurā tu esi svešinieks, ko Dievs deva Ābrahāmam.

28.en: 5And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
28.lv: 5 Un Īzaks sūtīja Jēkabu prom: un viņš gāja uz Padān-aramu pie Lābana, sīrieša Betuēla, dēla, Rebekas, Jēkaba un Ēsava mātes, brāļa.

28.en: 6When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
28.lv:
6

Kad Ēsavs redzēja, ka Īzaks bija svētījis Jēkabu un sūtījis viņu prom uz Padān-aramu ņemt sev sievu no turienes; un ka, viņam to svētījot, viņš tam piekodināja sacīdams, Tev nebūs ņemt sievu no Kanaāna meitām;

28.en: 7And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padanaram;
28.lv: 7 Un ka Jēkabs paklausīja savu tēvu un savu māti, un bija aizgājis uz Padān-aramu;

28.en: 8And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
28.lv: 8 Un Ēsavs redzēdams, ka Kanaāna meitas nepatika viņa tēvam Īzakam;

28.en: 9Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
28.lv: 9 Tad Ēsavs gāja pie Ismaēla un ņēma pie sievām, kas viņam bija, Mahalatu, Ābrahāma dēla Ismaēla, meitu, Nebājota māsu, par savu sievu.

28.en: 10 And Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.
28.lv:
10

Un Jēkabs izgāja no Bēr-šebas un gāja uz Hārānu.

28.en: 11 And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
28.lv: 11 Un viņš nonāca kādā vietā un uzkavējās tur visu nakti, tāpēc ka saule bija norietējusi; un viņš ņēma tās vietas akmeņus, un tos lika par saviem spilveniem, un apgūlās tajā vietā gulēt.

28.en: 12 And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
28.lv: 12 Un viņš sapņoja un redzēja kāpnes, uzstādītas uz zemes, un to gals aizsniedzās līdz debesij: un redzēja Dieva eņģeļus uzkāpjam un nokāpjam uz tām.

28.en: 13 And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
28.lv: 13 Un, lūk, tas KUNGS stāvēja virs tām un sacīja, Es esmu tas KUNGS, Ābrahāma, tava tēva, Dievs, un Īzaka Dievs: zemi, uz kā tu guli, es došu tev un tavai sēklai;

28.en: 14 And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
28.lv: 14 Un tava sēkla būs kā zemes pīšļi, un tu izplatīsies uz rietumiem un uz austrumiem, un uz ziemeļiem, un uz dienvidiem: un tevī un tavā sēklā visas zemes ģimenes tiks svētītas.

28.en: 15 And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
28.lv: 15 Un, lūk, es esmu ar tevi un tevi sargāšu visās vietās, kurp tu ej, un vedīšu tevi atpakaļ šajā zemē; jo es tevi neatstāšu, līdz es neesmu izdarījis to, par ko es uz tevi runāju.

28.en: 16 And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
28.lv:
16

Un Jēkabs pamodās no sava miega, un viņš sacīja, Bez šaubām, tas KUNGS ir šajā vietā; un es to nezināju.

28.en: 17 And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
28.lv: 17 Un viņš baidījās un sacīja, Cik baismīga ir šī vieta! šis nav nekas cits, kā tikai Dieva nams, un šie ir debess vārti.

28.en: 18 And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
28.lv: 18 Un Jēkabs cēlās agri no rīta un ņēma akmeni, ko viņš bija licis par saviem spilveniem, un uzstādīja to par pīlāri, un uzlēja eļļu uz tā gala.

28.en: 19 And he called the name of that place Bethel: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.
28.lv: 19 Un viņš sauca tās vietas vārdu Bētele: bet tās pilsētas vārds vispirms tika saukts Lūza.

28.en: 20And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
28.lv:
20

Un Jēkabs solīja solījumu sacīdams, Ja Dievs būs ar mani un mani sargās šajā ceļā, ko es eju, un dos man maizi ēst un tērpu apvilkt,

28.en: 21So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the LORD be my God:
28.lv: 21 Tā ka es nāku atpakaļ sava tēva namā mierā; tad tas KUNGS būs mans Dievs:

28.en: 22And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
28.lv: 22 Un šis akmens, ko es esmu licis par pīlāri, būs Dieva nams: un no visa, ko tu man dosi, es, bez šaubām, došu tev desmito daļu.

29.en: 1Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
29.lv: 1 Tad Jēkabs devās savā ceļā un nāca austrumu ļaužu zemē.

29.en: 2And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well's mouth.
29.lv: 2 Un viņš lūkojās, un uzlūkoja aku laukā, un rau, tur bija trīs avju ganāmpulki, gulēdami pie tās; jo no tās akas tie dzirdīja ganāmpulkus: un liels akmens bija uz akas atveres.

29.en: 3And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well's mouth in his place.
29.lv: 3 Un turp visi ganāmpulki sapulcējās: un tie novēla akmeni no akas atveres un dzirdīja avis, un lika akmeni atpakaļ uz akas atveres savā vietā.

29.en: 4And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.
29.lv: 4 Un Jēkabs tiem sacīja, Mani brāļi, no kurienes jūs esat? Un tie sacīja, No Hārānas mēs esam.

29.en: 5And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
29.lv: 5 Un viņš tiem sacīja, Vai jūs pazīstat Lābanu, Nāhora dēlu? Un tie sacīja, Mēs viņu pazīstam.

29.en: 6And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
29.lv: 6 Un viņš tiem sacīja, Vai viņam klājas labi? Un tie sacīja, Viņam klājas labi: un, lūk, Rāhēle, viņa meita, nāk ar avīm.

29.en: 7And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
29.lv: 7 Un viņš sacīja, Rau, vēl ir dienas vidus, nedz ir laiks, kad lopi tiktu sapulcināti kopā: dzirdiniet avis un ejiet, un ganiet tās.

29.en: 8And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.
29.lv: 8 Un tie sacīja, Mēs nevaram, līdz visi ganāmpulki tiek sapulcinātti kopā un, iekams tie noveļ akmeni no akas atveres; tad mēs dzirdījām avis.

29.en: 9And while he yet spake with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep: for she kept them.
29.lv:
9

Un, kamēr viņš vēl ar tiem runāja, Rāhēle nāca ar sava tēva avīm: jo viņa tās sargāja.

29.en: 10And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother.
29.lv: 10 Un notika, kad Jēkabs redzēja Lābana, savas mātes brāļa, meitu Rāhēli un Lābana, savas mātes brāļa, avis, ka Jēkabs nāca tuvu un novēla akmeni no akas atveres un dzirdīja Lābana, savas mātes brāļa, ganāmpulku.

29.en: 11And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
29.lv: 11 Un Jēkabs skūpstīja Rāhēli un pacēla savu balsi, un raudāja.

29.en: 12And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was Rebekah's son: and she ran and told her father.
29.lv: 12 Un Jēkabs stāstīja Rāhēlei, ka viņš bija viņas tēva brālis un ka viņš bija Rebekas dēls: un viņa skrēja un stāstīja savam tēvam.

29.en: 13And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
29.lv:
13

Un notika, kad Lābans dzirdēja vēstis par Jēkabu, viņa māsas dēlu, ka viņš skrēja viņu satikt un apskāva viņu, un skūpstīja viņu, un veda viņu savā namā. Un viņš Lābanam visu šo stāstīja.

29.en: 14And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
29.lv: 14 Un Lābans viņam sacīja, Bez šaubām, tu esi mani kauli un mana miesa. Un viņš palika pie viņa kādu mēnesi.

29.en: 15And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
29.lv:
15

Un Lābans Jēkabam sacīja, Tāpēc ka tu esi mans brālis, vai tāpēc tev kalpot man par neko? stāsti man, kāda būs tava alga?

29.en: 16And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
29.lv: 16 Un Lābanam bija divas meitas: vecākās vārds bija Lea un jaunākās vārds bija Rāhēle.

29.en: 17Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
29.lv: 17 Lea bija ar vārīgām acīm; bet Rāhēle bija skaista un ļoti piemīlīga.

29.en: 18And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
29.lv:
18

Un Jēkabs mīlēja Rāhēli; un sacīja, Es tev kalpošu septiņus gadus par Rāhēli, jaunāko meitu.

29.en: 19And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
29.lv: 19 Un Lābans sacīja, Labāk, ka es viņu dodu tev, nekā, ka es dotu viņu citam vīrietim: paliec pie manis.

29.en: 20And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
29.lv: 20 Un Jēkabs kalpoja septiņus gadus par Rāheli; un tie viņam šķita kā tikai nedaudzas dienas mīlestības dēļ, [kas] viņam bija pret viņu.

29.en: 21And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.
29.lv:
21

Un Jēkabs Lābanam sacīja, Dod man manu sievu, jo manas dienas ir piepildītas, lai es varu ieiet pie viņas.

29.en: 22And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
29.lv: 22 Un Lābans sapulcināja kopā visus tās vietas vīriešus un taisīja dzīres.

29.en: 23And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
29.lv: 23 Un notika vakarā, ka viņš ņēma Leu, savu meitu, un veda to pie viņa; un viņš iegāja pie tās.

29.en: 24And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
29.lv: 24 Un Lābans deva savai meitai Leai Zilpu, viņas meiteni par kalponi.

29.en: 25And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
29.lv: 25 Un notika, ka no rīta, lūk, tā bija Lea: un viņš Lābanam sacīja, Kas ir šis, ko tu man esi darījis? vai es tev nekalpoju par Rāhēli? kādēļ tad tu mani esi pievīlis?

29.en: 26And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
29.lv: 26 Un Lābans sacīja, Tā mūsu zemē nedrīkst darīt — dot jaunāko pirms pirmdzimtās.

29.en: 27Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
29.lv: 27 Piepildi viņas nedēļu, un es tev došu arī šo par tavu kalpošanu, ko tu man kalposi vēl septiņus citus gadus.

29.en: 28And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.
29.lv:
28

Un Jēkabs tā darīja un piepildīja viņas nedēļu: un viņš deva viņam arī Rāhēli, savu meitu, par sievu.

29.en: 29And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
29.lv: 29 Un Labāns deva Rāhēlei, savai meitai Bilhu, viņas kalponi, par viņas meiteni.

29.en: 30And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
29.lv: 30 Un viņš iegāja arī pie Rāhēlēs, un viņš arī mīlēja Rāhēli vairāk par Leu, un kalpoja pie viņa vēl septiņus citus gadus.

29.en: 31And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren.
29.lv:
31

Un, kad tas KUNGS redzēja, ka Lea bija ienīsta, viņš atvēra viņas klēpi: bet Rāhēle bija neauglīga.

29.en: 32And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the LORD hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
29.lv: 32 Un Lea kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu, un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Rūbens: jo viņa sacīja, Bez šaubām, tas KUNGS ir lūkojies uz manām sāpēm; tad nu tāpēc mans vīrs mani mīlēs.

29.en: 33And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Because the LORD hath heard that I was hated, he hath therefore given me this son also: and she called his name Simeon.
29.lv: 33 Un viņa atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un sacīja, Tāpēc ka tas KUNGS ir dzirdējis, ka es biju ienīsta, tāpēc viņš ir man devis arī šo dēlu: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Simeons.

29.en: 34And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have born him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
29.lv: 34 Un viņa atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un sacīja, Nu šajā reizē mans vīrs būs savienots ar mani, tāpēc ka es viņam esmu dzemdējusi trīs dēlus: tāpēc tā vārdu viņa nosauca Levijs.

29.en: 35And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, Now will I praise the LORD: therefore she called his name Judah; and left bearing.
29.lv: 35 Un viņa atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu: un viņa sacīja, Nu es slavēšu to KUNGU: tāpēc viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Jūda; un mitējās dzemdēt.

30.en: 1And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister; and said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.
30.lv: 1 Un, kad Rāhēle redzēja, ka viņa Jēkabam nedzemdēja bērnus, Rāhēle apskauda savu māsu; un viņa Jēkabam sacīja, Dod man bērnus vai arī es mirstu.

30.en: 2And Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
30.lv: 2 Un Jēkaba dusmas aizdegās pret Rāhēli: un viņš sacīja, Vai es esmu Dieva vietā, kurš no tevis ir atturējis klēpja augli?

30.en: 3And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.
30.lv: 3 Un viņa sacīja, Lūk, mana meitene Bilha, ieej pie viņas; un viņa dzemdēs uz maniem ceļiem, lai man arī var būt bērni caur viņu.

30.en: 4And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife: and Jacob went in unto her.
30.lv: 4 Un viņa deva viņam Bilhu, savu kalponi, par sievu: un Jēkabs iegāja pie viņas.

30.en: 5And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.
30.lv:
5

Un Bilha kļuva grūta un dzemdēja Jēkabam dēlu.

30.en: 6And Rachel said, God hath judged me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a son: therefore called she his name Dan.
30.lv: 6 Un Rāhēle sacīja, Dievs mani ir tiesājis un ir arī dzirdējis manu balsi, un man ir devis dēlu: tāpēc viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Dans.

30.en: 7And Bilhah Rachel's maid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.
30.lv: 7 Un Bilha, Rāhēles meitene, atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja Jēkabam otru dēlu.

30.en: 8And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.
30.lv: 8 Un Rāhēle sacīja, Ar lielu cīkstēšanos es esmu cīkstējusies ar savu māsu un es esmu guvusi virsroku: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Naftalis.

30.en: 9When Leah saw that she had left bearing, she took Zilpah her maid, and gave her Jacob to wife.
30.lv:
9

Kad Lea redzēja, ka viņa bija mitējusies dzemdēt, viņa ņēma Zilpu, savu meiteni, un deva viņu Jēkabam par sievu.

30.en: 10And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a son.
30.lv: 10 Un Zilpa, Leas meitene, dzemdēja Jēkabam dēlu.

30.en: 11And Leah said, A troop cometh: and she called his name Gad.
30.lv: 11 Un Lea sacīja, Karaspēks nāk: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Gads.

30.en: 12And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a second son.
30.lv: 12 Un Zilpa, Leas meitene, dzemdēja Jēkabam otru dēlu.

30.en: 13And Leah said, Happy am I, for the daughters will call me blessed: and she called his name Asher.
30.lv: 13 Un Lea sacīja, Laimīga es esmu, jo meitas mani sauks par svētītu: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Ašers.

30.en: 14And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son's mandrakes.
30.lv:
14

Un Rūbens gāja kviešu pļaujas dienās un atrada mandragoras laukā, un nesa tās savai mātei Leai. Tad Rāhēle sacīja Leai, Dod man, es tevi lūdzu, no sava dēla mandragorām.

30.en: 15And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son's mandrakes.
30.lv: 15 Un viņa tai sacīja, Vai tā ir maza lieta, ka tu esi ņēmusi manu vīru? un tu gribi atņemt arī mana dēla mandragoras? Un Rāhēle sacīja, Tāpēc viņš šonakt gulēs ar tevi tava dēla mandragoru dēļ.

30.en: 16And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in unto me; for surely I have hired thee with my son's mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.
30.lv: 16 Un Jēkabs nāca no lauka vakarā, un Lea izgāja viņu satikt un sacīja, Tev jāienāk pie manis: jo, bez šaubām, es esmu nomājusi tevi ar sava dēla mandragorām. Un viņš gulēja tajā naktī ar viņu.

30.en: 17And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived, and bare Jacob the fifth son.
30.lv:
17

Un Dievs uzklausīja Leu, un viņa kļuva grūta un dzemdēja Jēkabam piekto dēlu.

30.en: 18And Leah said, God hath given me my hire, because I have given my maiden to my husband: and she called his name Issachar.
30.lv: 18 Un Lea sacīja, Dievs man ir devis manu atalgojumu, tāpēc ka es esmu devusi savu meiteni savam vīram: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Isašars.

30.en: 19And Leah conceived again, and bare Jacob the sixth son.
30.lv: 19 Un Lea atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja Jēkabam sesto dēlu.

30.en: 20And Leah said, God hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have born him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.
30.lv: 20 Un Lea sacīja, Dievs mani ir apveltījis ar labu pūru; nu mans vīrs mājos ar mani, tāpēc ka es viņam esmu dzemdējusi sešus dēlus: un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Zebulons.

30.en: 21And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.
30.lv: 21 Un pēcāk viņa dzemdēja meitu un nosauca viņas vārdu Dīna.

30.en: 22And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to her, and opened her womb.
30.lv:
22

Un Dievs atcerējās Rāhēli, un Dievs viņu uzklausīja un atvēra viņas klēpi.

30.en: 23And she conceived, and bare a son; and said, God hath taken away my reproach:
30.lv: 23 Un viņa kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un sacīja, Dievs ir ņēmis prom manu negodu:

30.en: 24And she called his name Joseph; and said, The LORD shall add to me another son.
30.lv: 24 Un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Jāzeps; un viņa sacīja, Tas KUNGS man pieliks citu dēlu.

30.en: 25And it came to pass, when Rachel had born Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country.
30.lv:
25

Un notika, kad Rahēle bija dzemdējusi Jāzepu, ka Jēkabs Lābanam sacīja, Sūti mani prom, lai es varu iet uz savu paša vietu un uz savu zemi.

30.en: 26Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my service which I have done thee.
30.lv: 26 Dod man manas sievas un manus bērnus, par kuriem es tev esmu kalpojis un ļauj man iet: jo tu zini manu kalpošanu, ko es tev esmu darījis.

30.en: 27And Laban said unto him, I pray thee, if I have found favour in thine eyes, tarry: for I have learned by experience that the LORD hath blessed me for thy sake.
30.lv: 27 Un Lābans viņam sacīja, Es tevi lūdzu, ja es esmu atradis labvēlību tavās acīs, uzkavējies: jo es esmu mācījies caur pieredzi, ka tas KUNGS mani ir svētījis tevis dēļ.

30.en: 28And he said, Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.
30.lv: 28 Un viņš sacīja, Nosaki man savu algu, un es to došu.

30.en: 29And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy cattle was with me.
30.lv: 29 Un viņš tam sacīja, Tu zini, kā es tev kalpoju un kā tavi lopi bija ar mani.

30.en: 30For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and the LORD hath blessed thee since my coming: and now when shall I provide for mine own house also?
30.lv: 30 Jo tas bija nedaudz, kas tev bija pirms es nācu, un nu tas ir pieaudzis līdz pulkam; un tas KUNGS tevi ir svētījis kopš manas nākšanas: un, kad nu es nodrošināšu arī savam paša namam?

30.en: 31And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me any thing: if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed and keep thy flock:
30.lv: 31 Un viņš sacīja, Ko man tev būs dot? Un Jēkabs sacīja, Tev man neko nebūs dot; ja tu man darīsi šo, es atkal ganīšu un sargāšu tavu ganāmpulku:

30.en: 32I will pass through all thy flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted cattle, and all the brown cattle among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats: and of such shall be my hire.
30.lv: 32 Es iziešu šodien caur visu tavu ganāmpulku, noņemdams no turienes visus raibos un plankumainos lopus, un visus brūnos lopus starp avīm, un plankumainos un raibos starp kazām: un no tādiem būs mans atalgojums.

30.en: 33So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before thy face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.
30.lv: 33 Tā mana taisnība tev atbildēs nākamajā laikā, kad tā nāks par manu atalgojumu tavas sejas priekšā: ikviens, kas nav raibs un plankumains starp kazām, un brūns starp avīm, tas tiks skaitīts nozagts pie manis.

30.en: 34And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to thy word.
30.lv: 34 Un Lābans sacīja, Lūk, es vēlētos, lai varētu notikt atbilstoši tavam vārdam.

30.en: 35And he removed that day the he goats that were ringstraked and spotted, and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.
30.lv: 35 Un viņš noņēma tajā dienā āžus, kas bija svītraini un plankumaini, un visas kazas, kas bija raibas un plankumainas, un ikvienu, kam bija kaut kas balts tajā, un visas brūnās starp avīm, un deva tās viņa dēlu rokās.

30.en: 36And he set three days' journey betwixt himself and Jacob: and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.
30.lv: 36 Un viņš nostādīja trīs dienu gājumu starp sevi un Jēkabu: un Jēkabs ganīja pārējos Lābana ganāmpulkus.

30.en: 37And Jacob took him rods of green poplar, and of the hazel and chestnut tree; and pilled white strakes in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.
30.lv:
37

Un Jēkabs ņēma sev zaļas papeles un lazdas, un kastaņu rīkstes; un mizoja tajās baltas svītras, un lika baltumam parādīties, kas bija rīkstēs.

30.en: 38And he set the rods which he had pilled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.
30.lv: 38 Un viņš lika rīkstes, ko viņš bija mizojis, ganāmpulku priekšā notekās un dzirdīšanas silēs, kad ganāmpulki nāca dzert, lai tie kļūtu grūti, kad tie nāca dzert.

30.en: 39And the flocks conceived before the rods, and brought forth cattle ringstraked, speckled, and spotted.
30.lv: 39 Un ganāmpulki kļuva grūti rīkstu priekšā un dzemdēja lopus: svītrainus, raibus un plankumainus.

30.en: 40And Jacob did separate the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the ringstraked, and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto Laban's cattle.
30.lv: 40 Un Jēkabs nošķīra jērus un nostādīja ganāmpulku sejas pret svītrainajām, un visām brūnajām Lābana ganāmpulkā; un viņš lika savus paša ganāmpulkus atsevišķi, un nelika tos pie Lābana lopiem.

30.en: 41And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger cattle did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the cattle in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods.
30.lv: 41 Un notika, kad vien stiprākie lopi kļuva grūti, ka Jēkabs lika rīkstes lopu acu priekšā notekās, lai tie varētu kļūt grūti starp rīkstēm.

30.en: 42But when the cattle were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were Laban's, and the stronger Jacob's.
30.lv: 42 Bet kad lopi bija nespēcīgi, viņš tās nelika iekšā: tā nespēcīgākie bija Lābana, un stiprākie Jēkaba.

30.en: 43And the man increased exceedingly, and had much cattle, and maidservants, and menservants, and camels, and asses.
30.lv: 43 Un tas vīrietis ārkārtīgi pieauga, un [viņam] bija daudz lopu un kalpoņu, un kalpu, un kamieļu, un ēzeļu.

31.en: 1And he heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father's; and of that which was our father's hath he gotten all this glory.
31.lv: 1 Un viņš dzirdēja Lābana dēlu vārdus sakām, Jēkabs ir atņēmis visu, kas bija mūsu tēva; un no tā, kas bija mūsu tēva, viņš ir ieguvis visu šo godību.

31.en: 2And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
31.lv: 2 Un Jēkabs uzlūkoja Lābana vaigu, un lūk, tas nebija pret viņu kā iepriekš.

31.en: 3And the LORD said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
31.lv: 3 Un tas KUNGS Jēkabam sacīja, Atgriezies savu tēvu zemē un pie saviem radiem; un es būšu ar tevi.

31.en: 4And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,
31.lv: 4 Un Jēkabs sūtīja un aicināja Rāhēli un Leu uz lauku pie sava ganāmpulka,

31.en: 5And said unto them, I see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.
31.lv: 5 Un viņš tām sacīja, Es redzu jūsu tēva vaigu, ka tas nav pret mani kā iepriekš; bet mana tēva Dievs ir bijis ar mani.

31.en: 6And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
31.lv: 6 Un jūs zināt, ka ar visu savu spēku es esmu kalpojis jūsu tēvam.

31.en: 7And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.
31.lv: 7 Un jūsu tēvs mani ir pievīlis un mainījis manu algu desmit reizes; bet Dievs viņam neļāva man kaitēt.

31.en: 8If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then bare all the cattle ringstraked.
31.lv: 8 Ja viņš sacīja tā, Raibie būs tava alga; tad visi lopi dzemdēja raibus: un, ja viņš sacīja tā, Svītrainie būs tavs atalgojums; tad visi lopi dzemdēja svītrainus.

31.en: 9Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.
31.lv: 9 Tā Dievs ir atņēmis jūsu tēva lopus un devis tos man.

31.en: 10And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.
31.lv: 10 Un notika laikā, kad lopi kļuva grūti, ka es pacēlu savas acis un redzēju sapnī, un, lūk, auni, kas lēca uz lopiem, bija svītraini, plankumaini un lāsaini.

31.en: 11And the angel of God spake unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.
31.lv: 11 Un Dieva eņģelis runāja uz mani sapnī sacīdams, Jēkab: Un es sacīju, Šeit es esmu.

31.en: 12And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
31.lv: 12 Un viņš sacīja, Pacel nu savas acis un raugi, visi auni, kas lec uz lopiem, ir svītraini, plankumaini un lāsaini: jo es esmu redzējis visu, ko Lābans tev dara.

31.en: 13I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.
31.lv: 13 Es esmu Bēt-eles Dievs, kur tu svaidīji pīlāri un kur tu man solīji solījumu: celies nu, izej no šīs zemes un atgriezies uz savu radu zemi.

31.en: 14And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?
31.lv: 14 Un Rāhēle un Lea atbildēja un viņam sacīja, Vai mums vēl ir kāda tiesa vai mantojums mūsu tēva namā?

31.en: 15Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.
31.lv: 15 Vai mēs no viņa netiekam skaitītas kā svešinieces? jo viņš mūs ir pārdevis un arī ir pavisam aprijis mūsu naudu.

31.en: 16For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children's: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.
31.lv: 16 Jo visas bagātības, ko Dievs ir ņēmis no mūsu tēva, tās ir mūsu un mūsu bērnu: nu tad, ko vien Dievs tev ir sacījis, dari.

31.en: 17Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
31.lv:
17

Tad Jēkabs cēlās un nostādīja savus dēlus un savas sievas uz kamieļiem;

31.en: 18And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gotten, the cattle of his getting, which he had gotten in Padanaram, for to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.
31.lv: 18 Un viņš aizveda prom visus savus lopus un visas savas mantas, ko viņš bija ieguvis, sava ieguvuma lopus, ko viņš bija ieguvis Padān-aramā, lai ietu pie Īzaka, sava tēva, Kanaāna zemē.

31.en: 19And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father's.
31.lv:
19

Un Lābans gāja cirpt savas avis: un Rāhēle bija nozagusi tēlus, kas bija viņas tēva.

31.en: 20And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.
31.lv: 20 Un Jēkabs aizzagās sīrietim Lābanam nezinot tajā, ka viņš viņam nestāstīja, ka viņš bēga.

31.en: 21So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.
31.lv: 21 Tā viņš bēga ar visu, kas viņam bija; un viņš cēlās un gāja pāri upei, un nostādīja savu seju uz Gileāda kalnu.

31.en: 22And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.
31.lv:
22

Un Lābanam tika stāstīts trešajā dienā, ka Jēkabs bija aizbēdzis.

31.en: 23And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.
31.lv: 23 Un viņš ņēma savus brāļus sev līdzi un vajāja viņu septiņu dienu ceļu; un tie viņu panāca Gileāda kalnā.

31.en: 24And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
31.lv: 24 Un Dievs naktī sapnī nāca pie sīrieša Lābana un viņam sacīja, Pielūko, ka tu nerunā uz Jēkabu vai nu labu vai ļaunu.

31.en: 25Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.
31.lv:
25

Tad Labāns panāca Jēkabu. Tad nu Jēkabs bija uzslējis savu telti kalnā: un Lābans ar saviem brāļiem apmetās Gileāda kalnā.

31.en: 26And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?
31.lv: 26 Un Lābans Jēkabam sacīja, Ko tu esi darījis, ka tu esi aizzadzies man nezinot un aizvedis prom manas meitas, kā gūstekņus, ņemtus ar zobenu?

31.en: 27Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
31.lv: 27 Kādēļ tu bēgi prom slepeni un aizzagies no manis; un nestāstīji man, lai es varētu tevi sūtīt prom ar līksmību un ar dziesmām, ar tamburīnu, un ar arfu?

31.en: 28And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
31.lv: 28 Un neesi man ļāvis skūpstīt manus dēlus un manas meitas? tu nu esi darījis muļķīgi, tā darot.

31.en: 29It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
31.lv: 29 Vai manas rokas varā nav tev kaitēt: bet jūsu tēva Dievs runāja uz mani vakarnakt sacīdams, Pielūko, ka tu nerunā uz Jēkabu vai nu labu vai sliktu.

31.en: 30And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father's house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
31.lv: 30 Un nu, kaut arī tev būtu vajadzīgs aiziet, tāpēc ka tu gauži ilgojies pēc sava tēva nama, tomēr, kādēļ tu esi nozadzis manus dievus?

31.en: 31And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters from me.
31.lv: 31 Un Jēkabs atbildēja un Lābanam sacīja, Tāpēc ka es baidījos: jo es sacīju, Ja nu gadījumā tu ņemtu savas meitas no manis ar spēku.

31.en: 32With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
31.lv: 32 Pie kura vien tu atrodi savus dievus, lai viņš nedzīvo: mūsu brāļu priekšā izšķir, kas ir tavs pie manis, un ņem to sev. Jo Jēkabs nezināja, ka Rāhēle tos bija nozagusi.

31.en: 33And Laban went into Jacob's tent, and into Leah's tent, and into the two maidservants' tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent.
31.lv: 33 Un Lābans iegāja Jēkaba teltī un Leas teltī, un divu kalpoņu teltīs; bet viņš tos neatrada. Tad viņš izgāja no Leas telts un iegāja Rāhēles teltī.

31.en: 34Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel's furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
31.lv: 34 Tad nu Rāhēle bija ņēmusi tēlus un likusi tos kamieļa piederumos un apsēdusies uz tiem. Un Lābans izmeklēja visu telti, bet tos neatrada.

31.en: 35And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.
31.lv: 35 Un viņa savam tēvam sacīja, Lai tas nerada nepatiku manam kungam, ka es nevaru piecelties tavā priekšā; jo sievietes paraža ir uz manis. Un viņš meklēja, bet neatrada tēlus.

31.en: 36And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?
31.lv:
36

Un Jēkabs apskaitās un rājās ar Lābanu: un Jēkabs atbildēja un Lābanam sacīja, Kas ir mans noziegums? kas ir mans grēks, ka tu tik karsti mani esi vajājis?

31.en: 37Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.
31.lv: 37 Lai gan tu esi pārmeklējis visas manas lietas, ko tu esi atradis no visas savas saimes lietām? nostādi to šeit manu brāļu un savu brāļu priekšā, lai tie var tiesāt starp mums abiem.

31.en: 38This twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
31.lv: 38 Šos divdesmit gadus es esmu bijis ar tevi; tavas aitas un tavas kazas nav izmetušās, un tava ganāmpulka aunus es neesmu ēdis.

31.en: 39That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.
31.lv: 39 To, kas bija saplosīts no zvēriem, es tev neatnesu; es nesu tā zaudējumu; no manas rokas tu to pieprasīji, vai zagtu dienā, vai zagtu naktī.

31.en: 40Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
31.lv: 40 Tā es biju; dienā sausums mani aprija un sals naktī; un mans miegs gāja prom no manām acīm.

31.en: 41Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
31.lv: 41 Tā es esmu bijis divdesmit gadus tavā namā; es tev kalpoju četrpadsmit gadus par tavām divām meitām un sešus gadus par taviem lopiem: un tu manu algu esi mainījis desmit reizes.

31.en: 42Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
31.lv: 42 Ja vien mana tēva Dieva, Ābrahāma Dieva un Īzaka bijāšana nebūtu bijusi ar mani, bez šaubām, tu mani nu būtu sūtījis tukšu. Dievs ir redzējis manas sāpes un manu roku pūliņu un tevi vakarnakt norāja.

31.en: 43And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?
31.lv: 43 Un Lābans atbildēja un Jēkabam sacīja, Šīs meitas ir manas meitas, un šie bērni ir mani bērni, un šie lopi ir mani lopi, un viss, ko tu redzi, ir mans: un ko es varu darīt šajā dienā šīm manām meitām vai viņu bērniem, ko viņas ir dzemdējušas?
