31.en: 44Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
31.lv:
44

Tāpēc nāc nu, slēgsim derību, es un tu; un lai tā ir par liecību starp mani un tevi.

31.en: 45And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
31.lv: 45 Un Jēkabs ņēma akmeni un uzstādīja to par pīlāri.

31.en: 46And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.
31.lv: 46 Un Jēkabs saviem brāļiem sacīja, Savāciet akmeņus; un tie ņēma akmeņus un taisīja kaudzi: un tie ēda tur uz kaudzes.

31.en: 47And Laban called it Jegarsahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.
31.lv: 47 Un Lābāns to nosauca Jegar-sahadūta: bet Jēkabs to nosauca Galēda.

31.en: 48And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;
31.lv: 48 Un Lābans sacīja, Šī kaudze ir liecība starp mani un tevi šajā dienā. Tāpēc tās vārds tika nosaukts Galēda;

31.en: 49And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
31.lv: 49 Un Micpa; jo viņš sacīja, Tad KUNGS vēro starp mani un tevi, kad mēs neesam klāt viens otram.

31.en: 50If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
31.lv: 50 Ja tu sāpināsi manas meitas vai ja tu ņemsi citas sievas līdzās manām meitām, neviens nav ar mums; redzi, Dievs ir liecinieks starp mani un tevi.

31.en: 51And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee;
31.lv: 51 Un Lābans Jēkabam sacīja, Lūk, šī kaudze un, lūk, šis pīlārs, ko es esmu metis starp mani un tevi;

31.en: 52This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.
31.lv: 52 Šī kaudze ir liecība, un šīs pīlārs ir liecība, ka es neiešu garām šai kaudzei pie tevis un ka tu neiesi garām šim pīlāram pie manis, lai kaitētu.

31.en: 53The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.
31.lv: 53 Ābrahāma Dievs un Nahora Dievs, viņu tēva Dievs, lai tiesā starp mums. Un Jēkabs zvērēja pie sava tēva Īzaka bijāšanas.

31.en: 54Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.
31.lv: 54 Tad Jēkabs ziedoja upuri uz kalna un aicināja savus brāļus ēst maizi: un tie ēda maizi un uzkavējās kalnā visu nakti.

31.en: 55And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
31.lv: 55 Un agri no rīta Lābans cēlās un skūpstīja savus dēlus, un savas meitas, un tos svētīja: un Lābans aizgāja un atgriezās savā vietā.

32.en: 1And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
32.lv: 1 Un Jēkabs gāja tālāk savu ceļu, un Dieva eņģeļi viņu satika.

32.en: 2And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God's host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
32.lv: 2 Un, kad Jēkabs tos redzēja, viņš sacīja, Šis ir Dieva karapulks: un viņš nosauca tās vietas vārdu Mahanaima.

32.en: 3And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
32.lv:
3

Un Jēkabs sūtīja vēstnešus savā priekšā pie sava brāļa Ēsava uz Seīra zemi, Edoma zemi.

32.en: 4And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:
32.lv: 4 Un viņš tiem pavēlēja sacīdams, Tā jums būs runāt uz manu kungu Ēsavu; Tavs kalps Jēkabs saka tā, Es esmu piemājojis pie Lābana un palicis tur līdz šim:

32.en: 5And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
32.lv: 5 Un man ir vērši un ēzeļi, ganāmpulki, un kalpi, un kalpones: un es esmu sūtījis stāstīt savam kungam, lai es varu atrast žēlastību tavā skatienā.

32.en: 6And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
32.lv:
6

Un vēstneši atgriezās pie Jēkaba sacīdami, Mēs nācām pie tava brāļa Ēsava, un viņš arī nāk tevi satikt, un četrsimt vīrieši kopā ar viņu.

32.en: 7Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the flocks, and herds, and the camels, into two bands;
32.lv: 7 Tad Jēkabs ļoti baidījās un bija nospiests: un viņš dalīja ļaudis, kas bija ar viņu, un sīklopus un liellopus, un kamieļus divās grupās;

32.en: 8And said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape.
32.lv: 8 Un sacīja, Ja Ēsavs nāk pie vienas grupas un to sit, tad otra, kas ir palikusi, izbēgs.

32.en: 9And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will deal well with thee:
32.lv:
9

Un Jēkabs sacīja, Ak, mana tēva Ābrahāma Dievs un mana tēva Īzaka Dievs, tas KUNGS, kas man sacīja, Atgriezies uz savu zemi un pie saviem radiem, un es izturēšos pret tevi labi:

32.en: 10I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast shewed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.
32.lv: 10 Es neesmu cienīgs vismazākās no tavām žēlsirdībām un visas patiesības, ko tu esi rādījis savam kalpam; jo ar savu zizli es gāju pāri šai Jordānai; un nu es esmu kļuvis par divām grupām.

32.en: 11Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me, and the mother with the children.
32.lv: 11 Izpestī mani, es tevi lūdzu, no mana brāļa rokas, no Ēsava rokas: jo es viņu bīstos, lai viņš nenāk un nesit mani, un māti ar bērniem.

32.en: 12And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
32.lv: 12 Un tu sacīji, Bez šaubām, es tev darīšu labu un tavu sēklu taisīšu kā jūras smiltis, ko nevar saskaitīt pūļa dēļ.

32.en: 13And he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother;
32.lv:
13

Un viņš piemājoja tur tajā pašā naktī; un ņēma no tā, kas nāca viņa rokā, dāvanu savam brālim Ēsavam;

32.en: 14Two hundred she goats, and twenty he goats, two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,
32.lv: 14 Divi simti kazu un divdesmit āžu, divi simti aitu un divdesmit aunu,

32.en: 15Thirty milch camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bulls, twenty she asses, and ten foals.
32.lv: 15 Trīsdesmit piena kamieļu un viņu mazuļus, četrdesmit govis un desmit buļļus, divdesmit ēzeļus un desmit kumeļus.

32.en: 16And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves; and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
32.lv: 16 Un viņš tos nodeva savu kalpu rokā, ikvienu baru atsevišķi; un saviem kalpiem sacīja, Ejiet pāri manā priekšā un lieciet atstarpi starp baru un baru.

32.en: 17And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
32.lv: 17 Un viņš pavēlēja priekšējam sacīdams, Kad mans brālis Ēsavs tevi satiek un tev prasa sacīdams, Kura tu esi? un kurp tu ej? un kura ir šie tavā priekšā?

32.en: 18Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.
32.lv: 18 Tad tev būs sacīt, Tie ir tava kalpa Jēkaba; tā ir dāvana, sūtīta manam kungam Ēsavam: un lūk, arī viņš ir aiz mums.

32.en: 19And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him.
32.lv: 19 Un tā viņš pavēlēja otrajam un trešajam, un visiem, kas sekoja, bariem sacīdams, Šādi jums būs runāt uz Ēsavu, kad jūs viņu atrodat.

32.en: 20And say ye moreover, Behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept of me.
32.lv: 20 Un turklāt sakiet, Lūk, tavs kalps Jēkabs ir aiz mums. Jo viņš sacīja, Es viņu nomierināšu ar dāvanu, kas iet manā priekšā, un pēcāk es redzēšu viņa seju; ja nu gadījumā viņš mani pieņems.

32.en: 21So went the present over before him: and himself lodged that night in the company.
32.lv: 21 Tā dāvana gāja pāri viņa priekšā: un viņš pats apmetās tajā naktī grupā.

32.en: 22And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two womenservants, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford Jabbok.
32.lv: 22 Un viņš cēlās tajā naktī un ņēma savas divas sievas, un savas divas kalpones, un savus vienpadsmit dēlus, un gāja pāri Jabokas braslam.

32.en: 23And he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had.
32.lv: 23 Un viņš tos ņēma un sūtīja tos pāri strautam, un sūtīja pāri, kas viņam bija.

32.en: 24And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
32.lv:
24

Un Jēkabs bija palicis viens; tur ar viņu līdz rītausmai cīkstējās vīrietis.

32.en: 25And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
32.lv: 25 Un, kad viņš redzēja, ka viņš nevarēja gūt virsroku pār viņu, viņš aizskāra viņa augšstilba dobumu; un Jēkaba augšstilba dobums izgāja no locītavas, viņam ar to cīkstoties.

32.en: 26And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
32.lv: 26 Un viņš sacīja, Ļauj man iet, jo diena aust. Un viņš sacīja, Es neļaušu tev iet, ja vien tu mani nesvētī.

32.en: 27And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
32.lv: 27 Un viņš tam sacīja, Kāds ir tavs vārds? Un viņš sacīja, Jēkabs.

32.en: 28And he said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for as a prince hast thou power with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
32.lv: 28 Un viņš sacīja, Tavs vārds vairs netiks saukts Jēkabs, bet Israēls: jo kā princim, tev ir spēks pie Dieva un pie cilvēkiem, un esi guvis virsroku.

32.en: 29And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
32.lv: 29 Un Jēkabs viņam prasīja un sacīja, Stāsti man, es tevi lūdzu, savu vārdu. Un viņš sacīja, Kādēļ ir tas, ka tu prasi pēc mana vārda? Un viņš to tur svētīja.

32.en: 30And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
32.lv: 30 Un Jēkabs nosauca tās vietas vārdu Penuēla: jo es esmu redzējis Dievu seju pret seju, un mana dzīvība ir pasaudzēta.

32.en: 31And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.
32.lv:
31

Un viņam ejot pār Penuēlu, saule uzlēca pār viņu, un viņš kliboja uz sava augšstilba.

32.en: 32Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew that shrank.
32.lv: 32 Tāpēc Israēla bērni līdz šai dienai neēd no cīpslas, kas sarāvās, kas ir uz augšstilba dobuma: tāpēc ka viņš aizskāra Jēkaba augšstilba dobumu cīpslā, kas sarāvās.

33.en: 1And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
33.lv: 1 Un Jēkabs pacēla savas acis un palūkojās, un, lūk, Ēsavs nāca, un ar viņu četri simti vīriešu. Un viņš dalīja bērnus pie Leas un pie Rāhēles, un pie divām kalponēm.

33.en: 2And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
33.lv: 2 Un viņš lika kalpones ar viņu bērniem priekšā, un Leu un viņas bērnus pēc tam, un Rāhēli un Jāzepu vistālāk.

33.en: 3And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
33.lv: 3 Un viņš gāja pāri to priekšā un klanījās pie zemes septiņas reizes, līdz viņš nāca tuvu savam brālim.

33.en: 4And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.
33.lv: 4 Un Ēsavs skrēja viņu satikt un apskāva viņu, un krita uz viņa kakla, un skūpstīja viņu: un tie raudāja.

33.en: 5And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The children which God hath graciously given thy servant.
33.lv: 5 Un viņš pacēla savas acis un redzēja sievietes un bērnus; un sacīja, Kas ir šie ar tevi? Un viņš sacīja, Bērni, ko Dievs ir žēlastīgi devis tavam kalpam.

33.en: 6Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
33.lv: 6 Tad kalpones nāca tuvu, viņas un viņu bērni, un tie klanījās.

33.en: 7And Leah also with her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
33.lv: 7 Un Lea arī ar saviem bērniem nāca tuvu un klanījās: un pēc tam nāca tuvu Jāzeps un Rāhēle, un tie klanījās.

33.en: 8And he said, What meanest thou by all this drove which I met? And he said, These are to find grace in the sight of my lord.
33.lv: 8 Un viņš sacīja, Ko tu domāji ar visu šo baru, ko es satiku? Un viņš sacīja, Atrast žēlastību mana kunga skatienā.

33.en: 9And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself.
33.lv: 9 Un Ēsavs sacīja, Man ir diezgan, mans brāli; paturi to, kas tev ir, sev pašam.

33.en: 10And Jacob said, Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
33.lv: 10 Un Jēkabs sacīja, Nē, es tevi lūdzu, ja es esmu atradis žēlastību tavā skatienā, tad pieņem manu dāvanu no manas rokas: jo tāpēc es esmu redzējis tavu seju, kā es būtu redzējis Dieva seju, un tev ir patika pie manis.

33.en: 11Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
33.lv: 11 Ņem, es tevi lūdzu, manu svētību, kas tev ir vesta; tāpēc ka Dievs pret mani ir izturējies žēlastīgi un tāpēc ka man ir diezgan. Un viņš to skubināja, un tas to ņēma.

33.en: 12And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
33.lv: 12 Un viņš sacīja, Dosimies ceļā un iesim, un es iešu tavā priekšā.

33.en: 13And he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and the flocks and herds with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die.
33.lv: 13 Un viņš tam sacīja, Mans kungs zina, ka bērni ir maigi un sīklopi un liellopi ar jaunajiem ir ar mani: un ja vīrieši tos nodzītu vienu dienu, viss ganāmpulks nomirs.

33.en: 14Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
33.lv: 14 Lai mans kungs, es tevi lūdzu, iet pāri sava kalpa priekšā: un es vadīšu klusām, pēc tā, kā lopi, kas iet manā priekšā, un bērni spēj izturēt, līdz es nāku pie mana kunga uz Seiru.

33.en: 15And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
33.lv: 15 Un Ēsavs sacīja, Ļauj man nu atstāt ar tevi dažus no ļaudīm, kas ir ar mani. Un viņš sacīja, Kāda tam vajadzība? ļauj man atrast žēlastību mana kunga skatienā.

33.en: 16So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
33.lv:
16

Tā Ēsavs tajā dienā atgriezās savā ceļā uz Seīru.

33.en: 17And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
33.lv: 17 Un Jēkabs devās ceļā uz Sukotu un uzbūvēja sev namu, un taisīja būdiņas saviem lopiem: tāpēc tās vietas vārds tiek saukts Sukota.

33.en: 18And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram; and pitched his tent before the city.
33.lv:
18

Un Jēkabs nāca uz Šalēmu, Šehemas pilsētu, kas ir Kanaāna zemē, kad viņš nāca no Padān-aramas; un uzslēja savu telti pilsētas priekšā.

33.en: 19And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money.
33.lv: 19 Un viņš pirka lauka gabalu, kur viņš bijis izpletis savu telti no Hamora bērnu, Šehemas tēva, rokas par četrsimt naudas gabaliem.

33.en: 20And he erected there an altar, and called it Elelohe-Israel.
33.lv: 20 Un viņš tur uzslēja altāri un to nosauca El-elohe-Israel.

34.en: 1And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
34.lv: 1 Un Dīna, Leas meita, ko viņa dzemdēja Jēkabam, izgāja raudzīt zemes meitas.

34.en: 2And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.
34.lv: 2 Un, kad Šehems, hivieša Hamora dēls, zemes princis, viņu redzēja, viņš viņu ņēma un gulēja ar viņu, un viņu sagānīja.

34.en: 3And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel.
34.lv: 3 Un viņa dvēsele pieķērās Dīnai, Jēkaba meitai, un viņš mīlēja meiteni un runāja laipni ar meitiņu.

34.en: 4And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
34.lv: 4 Un Šehems runāja uz savu tēvu Hamoru sacīdams, Iegūsti man šo meiteni par sievu.

34.en: 5And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.
34.lv: 5 Un Jēkabs dzirdēja, ka viņš bija sagānījis Dīnu, viņa meitu: tad nu viņa dēli bija ar viņa lopiem laukā: un Jēkabs cieta klusu, līdz viņi bija nākuši.

34.en: 6And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
34.lv:
6

Un Hamors, Šehema tēvs, izgāja pie Jēkaba sarunāties ar viņu.

34.en: 7And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
34.lv: 7 Un Jēkaba dēli nāca no lauka, kad tie to dzirdēja: un tie vīrieši bija noskumuši, un tie bija ļoti apskaitušies, tāpēc ka viņš bija strādājis muļķību Israēlā, gulēdams ar Jēkaba meitu; ko nepienākas darīt.

34.en: 8And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.
34.lv: 8 Un Hamors sarunājās ar tiem sacīdams, Mana dēla Šehema dvēsele ilgojas pēc jūsu meitas: es jūs lūdzu dot viņu tam par sievu.

34.en: 9And make ye marriages with us, and give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
34.lv: 9 Un taisiet laulības ar mums, un dodiet savas meitas mums, un ņemiet mūsu meitas jums.

34.en: 10And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
34.lv: 10 Un jūs mājosiet ar mums: un zeme būs jūsu priekšā; mājojiet un tirgojieties tajā, un iegūstiet tajā savus īpašumus.

34.en: 11And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
34.lv: 11 Un Šehems sacīja viņas tēvam un viņas brāļiem, Ļaujiet man atrast žēlastību jūsu acīs, un, ko jūs man sacīsiet, es došu.

34.en: 12Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.
34.lv: 12 Prasiet man lielāko pūru un dāvanu, un es došu atbilstoši tam, ko jūs man sacīsiet: bet dodiet man meiteni par sievu.

34.en: 13And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had defiled Dinah their sister:
34.lv: 13 Un Jēkaba dēli Šehemam un viņa tēvam Hamoram atbildēja blēdīgi un sacīja, tāpēc ka viņš bija sagānījis Dīnu, viņu māsu:

34.en: 14And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:
34.lv: 14 Un viņi tiem sacīja, Mēs nevaram darīt šo lietu, dot mūsu māsu kādam, kas ir neapgraizīts; jo tas mums būtu par negodu:

34.en: 15But in this will we consent unto you: If ye will be as we be, that every male of you be circumcised;
34.lv: 15 Bet šajā mēs jums piekritīsim: ja jūs būsiet kā mēs esam, ka ikviens vīrišķis no jums tiek apgraizīts;

34.en: 16Then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
34.lv: 16 Tad mēs dosim mūsu meitas jums, un mēs ņemsim jūsu meitas mums, un mēs mājosim ar jums, un mēs kļūsim par vieniem ļaudīm.

34.en: 17But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
34.lv: 17 Bet, ja jūs mūs neuzklausīsiet tikt apgraizīti; tad mēs ņemsim mūsu meitu un aiziesim.

34.en: 18And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.
34.lv: 18 Un viņu vārdi patika Hamoram un Hamora dēlam Šehemam.

34.en: 19And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter: and he was more honourable than all the house of his father.
34.lv: 19 Un jauneklis nevilcinājās to darīt, tāpēc ka viņam bija prieks Jēkaba meitā: un viņš bija godājamāks par visu sava tēva namu.

34.en: 20And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
34.lv:
20

Un Hamors un viņa dēls Šehems nāca pie savas pilsētas vārtiem, un tie sarunājās ar savas pilsētas vīriešiem sacīdami,

34.en: 21These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
34.lv: 21 Šie vīrieši ir mierīgi pie mums; tāpēc lai tie mājo zemē un tirgojas tajā; jo zeme, lūk, ir liela diezgan tiem; ņemsim viņu meitas par mūsu sievām, un dosim tiem mūsu meitas.

34.en: 22Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
34.lv: 22 Tikai šajā vīrieši piekritīs mājot ar mums, būt vieni ļaudis, ja ikviens vīrišķis starp mums tiek apgraizīts, kā tie ir apgraizīti.

34.en: 23Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
34.lv: 23 Vai viņu lopi un viņu manta un ikviens viņu zvērs nebūs mūsu? tikai piekritīsim tiem, un tie mājos ar mums.

34.en: 24And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
34.lv: 24 Un Hamoru un viņa dēlu Šehemu uzklausīja visi, kas izgāja pa viņa pilsētas vārtiem; un ikviens vīrišķis tika apgraizīts, visi, kas izgāja no viņa pilsētas.

34.en: 25And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.
34.lv:
25

Un notika trešajā dienā, kad tie bija sāpēs, ka divi no Jēkaba dēliem, Simeons un Levijs, Dīnas brāļi, ņēma katrs savu zobenu un nāca uz pilsētu drošsirdīgi un nokāva visus vīriešus.

34.en: 26And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.
34.lv: 26 Un tie nokāva Hamoru un viņa dēlu Šehemu ar zobena asmeni, un ņēma Dīnu no Šehema nama, un izgāja.

34.en: 27The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
34.lv: 27 Jēkaba dēli nāca uz nokautajiem un aplaupīja pilsētu, tāpēc ka tie bija sagānījuši viņu māsu.

34.en: 28They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field,
34.lv: 28 Tie ņēma viņu avis un viņu vēršus, un viņu ēzeļus, un to, kas bija pilsētā, un to, kas bija laukā,

34.en: 29And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.
34.lv: 29 Un visu viņu turību, un visus viņu mazos, un viņu sievas tie ņēma gūstā, un aplaupīja pat visu to, kas bija namā.

34.en: 30And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
34.lv:
30

Un Jēkabs Simeonam un Levijam sacīja, Jūs mani esat iztrūcinājuši, likt man smirdēt starp zemes iedzīvotājiem, starp kanaāniešiem un periziešiem: un mani nedaudzu skaitā, tie sapulcēsies kopā pret mani un mani nokaus; un es tikšu iznīcināts, es un mans nams.

34.en: 31And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?
34.lv: 31 Un tie sacīja, Vai viņam vajag izturēties pret mūsu māsu kā pret ielasmeitu?

35.en: 1 And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
35.lv: 1 Un Dievs sacīja Jēkabam, Celies, dodies uz Bēt-eli, un mājo tur: un taisi tur altāri Dievam, kas tev parādījās, kad tu bēgi no Ēsava, sava brāļa, sejas.

35.en: 2 Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:
35.lv:
2

Tad Jēkabs sacīja savai saimei un visiem, kas bija ar viņu, Atmetiet svešos dievus, kas ir starp jums, un esiet tīri un pārmainiet savus apģērbus:

35.en: 3 And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
35.lv: 3 Un celsimies un dosimies uz Bēt-eli, un es tur taisīšu altāri Dievam, kurš man atbildēja manu spaidu dienā, un bija ar mani ceļā, kurā es gāju.

35.en: 4 And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
35.lv: 4 Un tie deva Jēkabam visus svešos dievus, kas bija viņu rokā, un visus savus auskarus, kas bija viņu ausīs; un Jēkabs tos paslēpa zem ozola, kas bija pie Šehemes.

35.en: 5And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
35.lv: 5 Un tie devās ceļā: un Dieva baismas bija uz pilsētām, kas bija ap tiem, un tie nevajāja Jēkaba dēlus.

35.en: 6So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.
35.lv:
6

Tā Jēkabs nāca uz Lūzu, kas ir Kanaāna zemē, kas ir Bēt-ele, viņš un visi ļaudis, kas bija ar viņu.

35.en: 7And he built there an altar, and called the place Elbethel: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
35.lv: 7 Un viņš tur uzbūvēja altāri un nosauca vietu El-bēt-el: tāpēc ka Dievs tur viņam parādījās, kad viņš bēga no sava brāļa sejas.

35.en: 8But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.
35.lv: 8 Bet Debora, Rebekas zīdītāja, nomira, un viņa tika apbedīta aiz Bēt-eles zem ozola: un tā vārds tika nosaukts Allon-bākūt.

35.en: 9And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.
35.lv:
9

Un Dievs atkal parādījās Jēkabam, kad viņš iznāca no Padan-aramas un viņu svētīja.

35.en: 10And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
35.lv: 10 Un Dievs viņam sacīja, Tavs vārds ir Jēkabs: tavu vārdu vairs nesauks Jēkabs, bet Israēls būs tavs vārds: un viņš nosauca viņa vārdu Israēls.

35.en: 11And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
35.lv: 11 Un Dievs viņam sacīja, Es esmu Dievs Visvarenais: augļojies un vairojies; tauta un tautu grupa būs no tevis, un ķēniņi iznāks no taviem gurniem;

35.en: 12And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
35.lv: 12 Un zeme, ko es devu Ābrahāmam un Īzakam, tev es to došu un tavai sēklai pēc tevis es došu zemi.

35.en: 13And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
35.lv: 13 Un Dievs uzgāja no viņa vietā, kur viņš ar to sarunājās.

35.en: 14And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
35.lv: 14 Un Jēkabs uzstādīja pīlāri vietā, kur viņš ar to runāja, proti, akmens pīlāri: un viņš uz tā uzlēja dzeramo ziedojumu, un viņš uz tā uzlēja eļļu.

35.en: 15And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Bethel.
35.lv: 15 Un Jēkabs nosauca vietas vārdu, kur Dievs ar viņu runāja, Bēt-ele.

35.en: 16And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.
35.lv:
16

Un tie devās ceļā no Bēt-eles; un bija tikai neliels ceļš nākt uz Efrātu: un Rāhēle dzemdēja, un viņai bija smagas dzemdības.

35.en: 17And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
35.lv: 17 Un notika, kad viņa bija smagās dzemdībās, ka vecmāte viņai sacīja, Nebīsties; tev būs arī šis dēls.

35.en: 18And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.
35.lv: 18 Un notika, viņas dvēselei aizejot, (jo viņa mira) ka viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Ben-oni: bet viņa tēvs nosauca viņu Benjamīns.

35.en: 19And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
35.lv: 19 Un Rāhēle nomira un tika apbedīta ceļā uz Efrātu, kas ir Bet-lēme.

35.en: 20And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.
35.lv: 20 Un Jēkabs uzstādīja pīlāri uz viņas kapa: tas ir Rāhēles kapa pīlāris līdz šai dienai.

35.en: 21And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
35.lv:
21

Un Israēls devās ceļā un izpleta savu telti aiz Ēdēra torņa.

35.en: 22And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
35.lv: 22 Un notika, kad Israēls mājoja tajā zemē, ka Rūbens gāja un gulēja ar Bilhu, sava tēva konkubīni: un Israēls to dzirdēja. Tad nu Jēkaba dēli bija divpadsmit:

35.en: 23The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
35.lv: 23 Leas dēli; Rūbens, Jēkaba pirmdzimtais un Simeons, un Levijs, un Jūda, un Isašars, un Zebulons:

35.en: 24The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
35.lv: 24 Rāhēles dēli; Jāzeps un Benjamīns:

35.en: 25And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:
35.lv: 25 Un Bilhas, Rāhēles kalpones, dēli; Dans un Naftalis:

35.en: 26And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padanaram.
35.lv: 26 Un Zilpas, Leas kalpones, dēli; Gads un Ašers: šie ir Jēkaba dēli, kas viņam bija dzimuši Padān-aramā.

35.en: 27And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
35.lv:
27

Un Jēkabs nāca pie sava tēva Īzaka uz Mamri, uz Arbas pilsētu, kas ir Hebrona, kur Ābrahāms un Īzaks piemājoja.

35.en: 28And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
35.lv: 28 Un Īzaka dienas bija simts astoņdesmit gadu.

35.en: 29And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
35.lv: 29 Un Īzaks atdeva garu un nomira, un tika piepulcināts saviem ļaudīm, būdams vecs un pilns dienu: un viņa dēli Ēsavs un Jēkabs viņu apbedīja.

36.en: 1Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.
36.lv: 1 Tad nu šīs ir Ēsava paaudzes, kas ir Edoms.

36.en: 2Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;
36.lv: 2 Ēsavs ņēma savas sievas no Kanaāna meitām; Adu, hētieša Ēlona meitu un Oholibāmu, hivieša Cibona meitu, Anas meitu;

36.en: 3And Bashemath Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
36.lv: 3 Un Ismaēla meitu Basmati, Nebājota māsu.

36.en: 4And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz; and Bashemath bare Reuel;
36.lv: 4 Un Āda Ēsavam dzemdēja Ēlifasu; un Basmate dzemdēja Reuēlu;

36.en: 5And Aholibamah bare Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, which were born unto him in the land of Canaan.
36.lv: 5 Un Oholibāma dzemdēja Jeūšu un Jaalāmu, un Korahu: šie ir Ēsava dēli, kas viņam bija dzimuši Kanaāna zemē.

36.en: 6And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the persons of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of Canaan; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob.
36.lv:
6

Un Ēsavs ņēma savas sievas un savus dēlus, un savas meitas, un visus sava nama cilvēkus, un savus lopus, un visus savus zvērus, un visu savu mantu, ko viņš bija ieguvis Kanaāna zemē; un gāja uz zemi no sava brāļa Jēkaba sejas.

36.en: 7For their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their cattle.
36.lv: 7 Jo viņu bagātība bija vairāk nekā, lai tie varētu mājot kopā; un zeme, kurā tie bija svešinieki, nevarēja tos panest viņu lopu dēļ.

36.en: 8Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.
36.lv: 8 Tā Ēsavs mājoja Seīra kalnā: Ēsavs ir Edoms.

36.en: 9And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:
36.lv:
9

Un šīs ir Ēsava, edomiešu tēva, paaudzes Seīra kalnā:

36.en: 10These are the names of Esau's sons; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau.
36.lv: 10 Šie ir Ēsava dēlu vārdi; Ēlifass, Ēsava sievas Ādas dēls, Reuēls, Ēsava sievas Basmates dēls.

36.en: 11And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.
36.lv: 11 Un Ēlifasa dēli bija Tēmāns, Omārs, Cefo un Gatāms, un Kenazs.

36.en: 12And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau's son; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek: these were the sons of Adah Esau's wife.
36.lv: 12 Un Timna bija Ēsava dēla Ēlifasa konkubīne; un viņa Ēlifasam dzemdēja Amaleku: šie bija Ēsava sievas Ādas dēli.

36.en: 13And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
36.lv: 13 Un šie ir Reuēla dēli; Nahats un Zerahs, Šamma, un Miza: šie ir Ēsava sievas Basmates dēli.

36.en: 14And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
36.lv:
14

Un šie ir Ēsava sievas Oholibāmas, Cibona meitas, Anas meitas, dēli: un viņa dzemdēja Ēsavam Jeūšu un Jaalāmu, un Korahu.

36.en: 15These were dukes of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn son of Esau; duke Teman, duke Omar, duke Zepho, duke Kenaz,
36.lv:
15

Šie bija Ēsava dēlu hercogi: Ēsava pirmdzimtā dēla Ēlifasa dēli; hercogs Tēmāns, hercogs Omārs, hercogs Cefo, hercogs Kenazs,

36.en: 16Duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these were the sons of Adah.
36.lv: 16 Hercogs Korahs, hercogs Gatāms un hercogs Amaleks: šie ir hercogi, kas nāca no Ēlifasa Edoma zemē; šie bija Ādas dēli.

36.en: 17And these are the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
36.lv:
17

Un šie ir Ēsava dēla Reuēla dēli; hercogs Nahats, hercogs Zerahs, hercogs Šamma, hercogs Miza: šie ir hercogi, kas nāca no Reuēla Edoma zemē; šie ir Ēsava sievas Basmates dēli.

36.en: 18And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau's wife; duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah: these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.
36.lv:
18

Un šie ir Ēsava sievas Oholibāmas dēli; hercogs Jeūšs, hercogs Jaalāms, hercogs Korahs: šie bija hercogi, kas nāca no Ēsava sievas Oholibāmas, Anas meitas.

36.en: 19These are the sons of Esau, who is Edom, and these are their dukes.
36.lv: 19 Šie ir Ēsava, kas ir Edoms, dēli, un šie ir viņu hercogi.

36.en: 20These are the sons of Seir the Horite, who inhabited the land; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,
36.lv:
20

Šie ir horieša Seīra dēli, kas apdzīvoja zemi; Lotāns un Šobāls, un Cibons, un Ana,

36.en: 21And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the dukes of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.
36.lv: 21 Un Dīšons, un Ēcers, un Dišāns: šie ir horiešu hrecogi, Seīra bērni Edoma zemē.

36.en: 22And the children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.
36.lv: 22 Un Lotāna bērni bija Horis un Hāmāms; un Lotāna māsa bija Timna.

36.en: 23And the children of Shobal were these; Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
36.lv: 23 Un Šobāla bērni bija šie; Alvāns un Mānahats, un Ēbals, Šefo un Onāms.

36.en: 24And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah, and Anah: this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
36.lv: 24 Un šie ir Cibona bērni; gan Aja, gan Ana: šis bija tas Ana, kas atrada mūļus tuksnesī, viņam ganot sava tēva Cibona ēzeļus.

36.en: 25And the children of Anah were these; Dishon, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
36.lv: 25 Un Anas bērni bija šie; Dīšons un Oholibāma, Anas meita.

36.en: 26And these are the children of Dishon; Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
36.lv: 26 Un šie ir Dīšona bērni; Hemdāns un Ešbāns, un Jitrāns, un Kerāns.

36.en: 27The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.
36.lv: 27 Ēcēra bērni ir šie; Bilhāns un Zaāvāns, un Akans.

36.en: 28The children of Dishan are these; Uz, and Aran.
36.lv: 28 Dišāna bērni ir šie; Ūcs un Arāns.

36.en: 29These are the dukes that came of the Horites; duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,
36.lv: 29 Šie ir hercogi, kas nāca no horiešiem; hercogs Lotāns, hercogs Šobāls, hercogs Cibons, hercogs Ana,

36.en: 30Duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan: these are the dukes that came of Hori, among their dukes in the land of Seir.
36.lv: 30 Hercogs Dīšons, hercogs Ēcērs, hercogs Dišāns: šie ir hercogi, kas nāca no Hori, starp viņu hercogiem Seīra zemē.

36.en: 31And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.
36.lv:
31

Un šie ir ķēniņi, kas valdīja Edoma zemē, pirms kāds ķēniņš valdīja pār Israēla bērniem.

36.en: 32And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
36.lv: 32 Un Bela, Beora dēls valdīja Edomā: un viņa pilsētas vārds bija Dinhāba.

36.en: 33And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
36.lv: 33 Un Bela nomira, un Jobābs, Zeraha dēls, no Bocras valdīja viņa vietā.

36.en: 34And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
36.lv: 34 Un Jobābs nomira, un Hūšāms no Tēmāna zemes valdīja viņa vietā.

36.en: 35And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
36.lv: 35 Un Hūšāms nomira, un Hadads, Bedada dēls, kurš Midiānu sita Moāba laukā, valdīja viņa vietā: un viņa pilsētas vārds bija Avīta.

36.en: 36And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
36.lv: 36 Un Hadads nomira, un Samla no Masrēkas valdīja viņa vietā.

36.en: 37And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
36.lv: 37 Un Samla nomira, un Sauls no Rehobotas pie upes valdīja viņa vietā.

36.en: 38And Saul died, and Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
36.lv: 38 Un Sauls nomira, un Baal-hānāns, Ahbora dēls, valdīja viņa vietā.

36.en: 39And Baalhanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
36.lv: 39 Un Baal-hānāns, Ahbora dēls, nomira, un Hadars valdīja viņa vietā: un viņa pilsētas vārds bija Pāu; un viņa sievas vārds bija Mehētabēla, Matrēdas meita, Mēzahāba meita.

36.en: 40And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
36.lv: 40 Un šie ir hercogu vārdi, kas nāca no Ēsava atbilstoši viņu ģimenēm, pēc viņu vietām; hercogs Timna, hercogs Alva, hercogs Jetēts,

36.en: 41Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
36.lv: 41 Hercogs Oholibāma, hercogs Ēl, hercogs Pīnons,

36.en: 42Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
36.lv: 42 Hercogs Kenazs, hercogs Tēmāns, hercogs Mibcars,

36.en: 43Duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these be the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he is Esau the father of the Edomites.
36.lv: 43 Hercogs Magdiēls, hercogs Īrāms: šie ir Edoma hercogi atbilstoši viņu mitekļiem viņu īpašuma zemē: viņš ir Ēsavs, edomiešu tēvs.

37.en: 1And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
37.lv: 1 Un Jēkabs mājoja zemē, kurā viņa tēvs bija svešinieks, Kanaāna zemē.

37.en: 2These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.
37.lv: 2 Šīs ir Jēkaba paaudzes. Jāzeps, būdams septiņpadsmit gadu vecs, ganīja ganāmpulku ar saviem brāļiem; un zēns bija ar Bilhas un Zilpas, viņa tēva sievu, dēliem: un Jāzeps nesa savam tēvam viņu ļauno liecību.

37.en: 3Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.
37.lv: 3 Tad nu Israēls Jāzepu mīlēja vairāk par visiem saviem bērniem, tāpēc ka viņš bija viņa lielā vecuma dēls: un viņš taisīja viņam daudzkrāsainus svārkus.

37.en: 4And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
37.lv: 4 Un, kad viņa brāļi redzēja, ka viņu tēvs viņu mīlēja vairāk par visiem viņa brāļiem, tie viņu ienīda un nevarēja ar viņu runāt mierīgi.

37.en: 5And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
37.lv:
5

Un Jāzeps sapņoja sapni, un viņš to stāstīja saviem brāļiem: un tie viņu ienīda vēl vairāk.

37.en: 6And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
37.lv: 6 Un viņš tiem sacīja, Klausieties, es jūs lūdzu, šo sapni, ko es esmu sapņojis:

37.en: 7For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.
37.lv: 7 Jo, lūk, mēs laukā sējām kūlīšus, un, rau, mans kūlītis cēlās un arī stāvēja taisni; un, lūk, jūsu kūlīši stāvēja visapkārt un paklanījās manam kūlītim.

37.en: 8And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
37.lv: 8 Un viņa brāļi tam sacīja, Vai tu patiešām valdīsi pār mums? vai tev patiešām būs vara pār mums? Un tie viņu ienīda vēl vairāk par viņa sapņiem un par viņa vārdiem.

37.en: 9And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.
37.lv:
9

Un viņš sapņoja vēl citu sapni un to stāstīja saviem brāļiem, un sacīja, Lūk, es vēl esmu sapņojis sapni; un, lūk, saule un mēness, un vienpadsmit zvaigznes man paklanījās.

37.en: 10And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
37.lv: 10 Un viņš to stāstīja savam tēvam un saviem brāļiem: un viņa tēvs to norāja un viņam sacīja, Kas ir šis sapnis, ko tu esi sapņojis? Vai es un tava māte, un tavi brāļi patiešām nāksim tev klanīties pie zemes?

37.en: 11And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.
37.lv: 11 Un viņa brāļi viņu apskauda; bet viņa tēvs ievēroja to vārdu.

37.en: 12And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.
37.lv:
12

Un viņa brāļi gāja ganīt sava tēva ganāmpulku Šehemā.

37.en: 13And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
37.lv: 13 Un Israēls Jāzepam sacīja, Vai tavi brāļi negana ganāmpulku Šehemā? nāc, un es tevi sūtīšu pie tiem. Un viņš tam sacīja, Šeit es esmu.

37.en: 14And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
37.lv: 14 Un viņš tam sacīja, Ej, es tevi lūdzu, raugi, vai labi klājas taviem brāļiem un labi ganāmpulkiem; un paziņo atkal man. Tā viņš to izsūtīja no Hebronas lejas, un viņš nāca uz Šehemu.

37.en: 15And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
37.lv:
15

Un kāds vīrietis viņu atrada, un, lūk, viņš klejoja laukā: un vīrietis viņam prasīja sacīdams, Ko tu meklē?

37.en: 16And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
37.lv: 16 Un viņš sacīja, Es meklēju savus brāļus: stāsti man, es tevi lūdzu, kur tie gana savus ganāmpulkus.

37.en: 17And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
37.lv: 17 Un vīrietis sacīja, Tie ir aizgājuši no šejienes; jo es dzirdēju tos sakām, Iesim uz Dotānu. Un Jāzeps gāja pakaļ saviem brāļiem un tos atrada Dotānā.

37.en: 18And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
37.lv: 18 Un, kad tie viņu redzēja no tālienes, pat pirms viņš nāca tiem tuvu, tie sazvērējās pret viņu, lai viņu nokautu.

37.en: 19And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
37.lv: 19 Un tie cits citam sacīja, Lūk, šis sapņotājs nāk.

37.en: 20Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
37.lv: 20 Tāpēc nāciet nu un nokausim viņu, un metīsim viņu kādā bedrē, un mēs sacīsim, Kāds ļauns zvērs viņu ir aprijis: un mēs redzēsim, kas kļūs no viņa sapņiem.

37.en: 21And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
37.lv: 21 Un Rūbens to dzirdēja, un viņš to izpestīja no viņu rokām; un viņš sacīja, Nenogalināsim viņu.

37.en: 22And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.
37.lv: 22 Un Rūbens tiem sacīja, Neizlejiet asinis, bet metiet viņu šajā bedrē, kas ir tuksnesī, un nepielieciet viņam roku; lai viņš to varētu atbrīvot no viņu rokām, izpestīt viņu atpakaļ savam tēvam.

37.en: 23And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stript Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;
37.lv:
23

Un notika, kad Jāzeps bija nācis pie saviem brāļiem, ka tie noģērba Jāzepam viņa svārkus, viņa daudzkrāsainos svārkus, kas viņam bija virsū;

37.en: 24And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
37.lv: 24 Un tie viņu ņēma, un viņu meta bedrē: un bedre bija tukša, tur nebija iekšā ūdens.

37.en: 25And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
37.lv: 25 Un tie apsēdās ēst maizi: un tie pacēla savas acis un palūkojās, un lūk, išmaēliešu grupa nāca no Gileādas ar saviem kamieļiem, nesdami smaržīgas zāles un balzāmu, un mirres, iedami to nonest uz Ēģipti.

37.en: 26And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
37.lv: 26 Un Jūda saviem brāļiem sacīja, Kāds labums ir, ja mēs nokaujam savu brāli un noslēpjam viņa asinis?

37.en: 27Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
37.lv: 27 Nāciet un pārdosim viņu ismaēliešiem, un lai mūsu roka nav uz viņu; jo viņš ir mūsu brālis un mūsu miesa. Un viņa brāļi piekrita.

37.en: 28Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
37.lv:
28

Tad tur gāja garām midiāniešu tirgotāji; un tie izvilka un izcēla Jāzepu no bedres un pārdeva Jāzepu ismaēliešiem par divdesmit sudraba gabaliem: un tie aizveda Jāzepu uz Ēģipti.

37.en: 29And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
37.lv:
29

Un Rūbens atgriezās pie bedres; un, lūk, Jāzeps nebija bedrē; un viņš saplēsa savas drēbes.

37.en: 30And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
37.lv: 30 Un viņš atgriezās pie saviem brāļiem un sacīja, Bērna nav; un man, kurp man būs iet?

37.en: 31And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
37.lv: 31 Un tie ņēma Jāzepa svārkus un nogalināja kazlēnu no kazām, un iemērca svārkus asinīs;

37.en: 32And they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be thy son's coat or no.
37.lv: 32 Un tie sūtīja daudzkrāsainos svārkus, un tie nesa tos savam tēvam; un sacīja, Šo mēs esam atraduši: tad nu atzīsti, vai tie ir vai nav tava dēla svārki.

37.en: 33And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
37.lv: 33 Un viņš tos pazina un sacīja, Tie ir mana dēla svārki; ļauns zvērs viņu ir aprijis; Jāzeps bez šaubām ir saplosīts gabalos.

37.en: 34And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
37.lv: 34 Un Jēkabs saplēsa savas drēbes un uzvillka uz saviem gurniem maisaudumu, un sēroja par savu dēlu daudz dienu.

37.en: 35And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
37.lv: 35 Un visi viņa dēli un visas viņa meitas cēlās viņu mierināt; bet viņš atteicās tikt mierināts; un viņš sacīja, Jo es sērodams noiešu kapā pie sava dēla. Tā viņa tēvs raudāja par viņu.

37.en: 36And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
37.lv:
36

Un midiānieši viņu pārdeva Ēģiptē Potifaram, faraona virsniekam un gvardes kapteinim.

38.en: 1And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
38.lv: 1 Un tajā laikā notika, ka Jūda nogāja no saviem brāļiem un iegriezās pie kāda adullāmieša, kura vārds bija Hīra.

38.en: 2And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
38.lv: 2 Un Jūda tur ieraudzīja kādu kanaāniešu meitu, kura vārds bija Šua; un viņš ņēma viņu un iegāja pie viņas.

38.en: 3And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
38.lv: 3 Un viņa kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un viņš nosauca viņa vārdu Gērs.

38.en: 4And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
38.lv: 4 Un viņa atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un viņa nosauca viņa vārdu Onāns.

38.en: 5And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
38.lv: 5 Un viņa atkal kļuva grūta un dzemdēja dēlu; un nosauca viņa vārdu Šēla: un viņš bija Kezībā, kad viņa to dzemdēja.

38.en: 6And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
38.lv:
6

Un Jūda ņēma sievu savam pirmdzimtajam Gēram, kuras vārds bija Tamāra.

38.en: 7And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
38.lv:
7

Un Jūdas pirmdzimtais Gērs bija nelietīgs tā KUNGA skatienā; un tas KUNGS viņu nokāva.

38.en: 8And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
38.lv:
8

Un Jūda Onānam sacīja, Ieej pie sava brāļa sievas un preci viņu, un uzcel sēklu savam brālim.

38.en: 9And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
38.lv: 9 Un Onāns zināja, ka sēkla nebūtu viņa; un notika, kad viņš iegāja pie sava brāļa sievas, ka viņš to izlēja zemē, lai viņš nedotu sēklu savam brālim.

38.en: 10And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
38.lv: 10 Un tas, ko viņš darīja, nepatika tam KUNGAM: tādēļ viņš to arī nokāva.

38.en: 11Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
38.lv: 11 Tad Jūda sacīja savai vedeklai Tamārai, Paliec atraitne sava tēva namā, iekams mans dēls Šēla būs izaudzis: jo viņš sacīja, Lai gadījumā viņš arī nemirst kā viņa brāļi. Un Tamāra gāja un mājoja sava tēva namā.

38.en: 12And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
38.lv:
12

Un laika gaitā Šuas meita, Jūdas sieva, nomira; un Jūda tika mierināts un devās pie saviem avju cirpējiem uz Timnu, viņš un viņa draugs adullamietis Hirā.

38.en: 13And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
38.lv:
13

Un tas tika stāstīts Tamārai sakot, Lūk, tavs vīratēvs dodas uz Timnu cirpt savas avis.

38.en: 14And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
38.lv: 14 Un viņa sev novilka savu atraitnes apģērbu un apsedzās ar apsegu, un ietinās, un sēdēja atklātā vietā, kas ir gar ceļu uz Timnu; jo viņa redzēja, ka Šelā bija izaudzis, un viņa netika tam dota par sievu.

38.en: 15When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
38.lv: 15 Kad Jūda viņu redzēja, viņš domāja, viņu esam ielasmeitu; tāpēc ka viņa bija apsegusi savu seju.

38.en: 16And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
38.lv: 16 Un viņš griezās pie viņas no ceļa un sacīja, Ļauj man, es tevi lūdzu, ieiet pie tevis; (jo viņš nezināja, ka tā bija viņa vedekla.) Un viņa sacīja, Ko tu man dosi, lai tu vari ienākt pie manis?

38.en: 17And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
38.lv: 17 Un viņš sacīja, Es tev sūtīšu kazlēnu no ganāmpulka. Un viņa sacīja, Vai tu man dosi ķīlu, iekams tu to sūti?

38.en: 18And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
38.lv: 18 Un viņš sacīja, Kādu ķīlu man tev būs dot? Un viņa sacīja, Tavu zīmogu un tavas rokassprādzes, un tavu zizli, kas ir tavā rokā. Un viņš to viņai deva un ienāca pie viņas, un viņa kļuva no viņa grūta.

38.en: 19And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
38.lv: 19 Un viņa cēlās un aizgāja prom, un nolika savu apsegu no sevis un uzvilka savas atraitnības apģērbus.

38.en: 20And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
38.lv:
20

Un Jūda sūtīja kazlēnu caur sava drauga adullāmieša roku saņemt savu ķīlu no sievietes rokas: bet viņš to neatrada.

38.en: 21Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.
38.lv: 21 Tad viņš prasīja tās vietas vīriešiem sacīdams, Kur ir ielasmeita, kas bija atklāti gar ceļa malu? Un tie sacīja, Šajā vietā nebija ielasmeitas.

38.en: 22And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
38.lv:
22

Un viņš atgriezās pie Jūdas un sacīja, Es nevaru viņu atrast; un arī tās vietas vīrieši sacīja, ka šajā vietā nebija ielasmeitas.

38.en: 23And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
38.lv: 23 Un Jūda sacīja, lai viņa to ņem sev, lai mēs netiekam apkaunoti: lūk, es sūtīju šo kazlēnu, un tu viņu neesi atradis.

38.en: 24And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
38.lv:
24

Un notika apmēram pēc trīs mēnešiem, ka Jūdam tika stāstīts sakot, Tava vedekla Tamāra ir dzinusi maucību; un arī, lūk, viņa ir grūta no maucības. Un Jūda sacīja, Izvediet viņu un lai viņa tiek sadedzināta.

38.en: 25When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
38.lv: 25 Kad viņa tika izvesta, viņa sūtīja pie sava vīratēva sacīdama, No vīrieša, kura ir šie, es esmu grūta: un viņa sacīja, Izšķir, es tevi lūdzu, kura šie ir, zīmogs un rokassprādzes, un zizlis.

38.en: 26And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
38.lv: 26 Un Jūda atzina tos un sacīja, Viņa ir bijusi taisnāka par mani; tāpēc ka es nedevu viņu savam dēlam Šēlam. Un viņš viņu vairs neatzina.

38.en: 27And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
38.lv:
27

Un notika viņas dzemdību laikā, ka, lūk, dvīņi bija viņas klēpī.

38.en: 28And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
38.lv: 28 Un notika, kad viņa dzemdēja, ka viens izstiepa savu roku: un vecmāte ņēma un apsēja viņa roku ar košsarkanu diegu sacīdama, Šis iznāca pirmais.

38.en: 29And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
38.lv: 29 Un notika, viņam ievelkot savu roku, ka, lūk, viņa brālis iznāca: un viņa sacīja, Kā tu esi izlauzies? šis robs lai ir uz tevi: tāpēc viņa vārds tika nosaukts Perecs.

38.en: 30And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.
38.lv: 30 Un pēcāk iznāca viņa brālis, kam bija košsarkans diegs uz viņa rokas: un viņa vārds tika nosaukts Zerahs.

39.en: 1And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.
39.lv: 1 Un Jāzeps tika novests uz Ēģipti; un Poti-fars, faraona virsnieks, gvardes kapteinis, ēģiptietis, nopirka viņu no išmaēliešu rokām, kas bija viņu turp noveduši.

39.en: 2And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
39.lv: 2 Un tas KUNGS bija ar Jāzepu, un viņš bija sekmīgs vīrietis; un viņš bija sava saimnieka ēģiptieša namā.

39.en: 3And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
39.lv: 3 Un viņa saimnieks redzēja, ka tas KUNGS bija ar viņu un ka tas KUNGS visam, ko viņš darīja, lika sekmēties viņa rokā.

39.en: 4And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
39.lv: 4 Un Jāzeps atrada žēlastību viņa skatienā, un viņš tam kalpoja: un viņš to iecēla par uzraugu pār savu namu un visu, kas viņam bija, viņš lika viņa rokā.

39.en: 5And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
39.lv: 5 Un notika no tā laika, kad viņš to bija iecēlis par uzraugu savā namā un pār visu, kas viņam bija, ka tas KUNGS Jāzepa dēļ svētīja ēģiptieša namu; un tā KUNGA svētība bija uz visu, kas viņam bija namā un laukā.

39.en: 6And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.
39.lv: 6 Un visu, kas viņam bija, viņš atstāja Jāzepa rokā; un viņš nezināja, kas viņam bija, kā tikai maizi, ko viņš ēda. Un Jāzeps bija glīts vīrietis un lielā labvēlībā.

39.en: 7And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
39.lv:
7

Un pēc šī notika, ka viņa saimnieka sieva meta savas acis uz Jāzepu; un viņa sacīja, Guli ar mani.

39.en: 8But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
39.lv: 8 Bet viņš atteicās un sacīja sava saimnieka sievai, Lūk, mans saimnieks nezina, kas ir ar mani namā, un visu, kas viņam ir, viņš ir uzticējis manai rokai;

39.en: 9There is none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
39.lv: 9 Nav neviena lielāka par mani šajā namā; nedz viņš kaut ko ir atturējis no manis, kā tikai tevi, tāpēc ka tu esi viņa sieva: kā tad es varu darīt šo lielo nelietību un grēkot pret Dievu?

39.en: 10And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
39.lv: 10 Un notika, viņai runājot uz Jāzepu dienu no dienas, ka viņš to neuzklausīja gulēt ar viņu vai būt ar viņu.

39.en: 11And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
39.lv: 11 Un notika ap šo laiku, ka Jāzeps iegāja namā darīt savas darīšanas; un tur iekšā nebija neviena no nama vīriešiem.

39.en: 12And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
39.lv: 12 Un viņa noķēra viņu pie viņa apģērba sacīdama, Guli ar mani: un viņš atstāja savu apģērbu viņas rokā un bēga, un izgāja ārā.

39.en: 13And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
39.lv:
13

Un notika, kad viņa redzēja, ka viņš bija atstājis savu apģērbu viņas rokā un bija izbēdzis,

39.en: 14That she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
39.lv: 14 Ka viņa sauca sava nama vīriešiem un runāja uz tiem sacīdama, Raugiet, viņš pie mums ir ievedis ebreju mūs izsmiet; viņš ienāca pie manis gulēt ar mani, un es saucu ar skaļu balsi:

39.en: 15And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
39.lv: 15 Un notika, kad viņš dzirdēja, ka es pacēlu savu balsi un saucu, ka viņš atstāja savu apģērbu pie manis un bēga, un izgāja ārā.

39.en: 16And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
39.lv: 16 Un viņa nolika viņa apģērbu sev blakus, līdz viņa kungs nāca mājās.

39.en: 17And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
39.lv: 17 Un viņa runāja uz viņu pēc šiem vārdiem sacīdama, Ebreju kalps, ko tu mums esi atvedis, ienāca pie manis mani izsmiet:

39.en: 18And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
39.lv: 18 Un notika, man paceļot savu balsi un saucot, ka viņš atstāja savu apģērbu pie manis un izbēga.

39.en: 19And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
39.lv: 19 Un notika, kad viņa saimnieks dzirdēja savas sievas vārdus, ko viņa uz to runāja sacīdama, Šādi tavs kalps man darīja; ka viņa bardzība aizdegās.

39.en: 20And Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
39.lv:
20

Un Jāzepa saimnieks viņu ņēma un lika viņu cietumā, vietā, kur bija saistīti ķēniņa cietumnieki: un viņš tur bija cietumā.

39.en: 21But the LORD was with Joseph, and shewed him mercy, and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
39.lv:
21

Bet tas KUNGS bija ar Jāzepu un viņam rādīja žēlsirdību, un viņam deva labvēlību cietuma sarga skatienā.

39.en: 22And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
39.lv: 22 Un cietuma sargs uzticēja Jāzepa rokā visus cietumniekus, kas bija cietumā; un, ko vien tie tur darīja, viņš bija tā darītājs.

39.en: 23The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
39.lv: 23 Cietuma sargs nelūkojās uz neko, kas bija zem viņa rokas; tāpēc ka tas KUNGS bija ar viņu un to, ko viņš darīja — tas KUNGS tam lika sekmēties.

40.en: 1And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of Egypt.
40.lv: 1 Un pēc šī notika, ka Ēģiptes ķēniņa dzērienu devējs un viņa maiznieks bija apgrēcinājuši savu kungu, Ēģiptes ķēniņu.

40.en: 2And Pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
40.lv: 2 Un faraons apskaitās pret diviem no saviem virsniekiem, pret dzērienu devēju galveno un pret maiznieku galveno.

40.en: 3And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
40.lv: 3 Un viņš tos lika apsardzē gvardes kapteiņa namā, cietumā, vietā, kur Jāzeps bija saistīts.

40.en: 4And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
40.lv: 4 Un gvardes kapteinis norīkoja Jāzepu pie tiem, un viņš tiem kalpoja: un tie palika kādu laiku apsardzē.

40.en: 5And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
40.lv:
5

Un tie sapņoja sapni, tie abi, katrs savu sapni vienā naktī, katrs atbilstoši sava sapņa tulkojumam, Ēģiptes ķēniņa dzērienu devējs un maiznieks, kas bija saistīti cietumā.

40.en: 6And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
40.lv: 6 Un Jāzeps ienāca pie tiem no rīta un palūkojās uz tiem, un lūk, tie bija bēdīgi.

40.en: 7And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
40.lv: 7 Un viņš prasīja faraona virsniekiem, kas bija ar viņu kopā viņa kunga nama apsardzē sacīdams, Kādēļ jūs šodien izskatāties tik bēdīgi?

40.en: 8And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
40.lv: 8 Un tie viņam sacīja, Mēs esam sapņojuši sapni un nav tā tulkotāja. Un Jāzeps tiem sacīja, Vai tulkojumi nepieder Dievam? stāstiet tos man, es jūs lūdzu.

40.en: 9And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
40.lv: 9 Un galvenais dzērienu devējs stāstīja savu sapni Jāzepam un viņam sacīja, Savā sapnī, lūk, vīnogulājs bija manā priekšā;

40.en: 10And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
40.lv: 10 Un vīnogulājā bija trīs zari: un tas bija tā, it kā pumpurotos, un tā ziedi izdīga; un tā ķekari izdeva nogatavojušās vīnogas:

40.en: 11And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.
40.lv: 11 Un faraona kauss bija manā rokā: un es ņēmu vīnogas un spiedu tās faraona kausā, un es devu kausu faraona rokā.

40.en: 12And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:
40.lv: 12 Un Jāzeps viņam sacīja, Šis ir tā tulkojums: Trīs zari ir trīs dienas:

40.en: 13Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
40.lv: 13 Vēl trīs dienās faraons pacels tavu galvu un atjaunos tevi tavā vietā: un tu nodosi faraona kausu viņa rokā pēc iepriekšējās paražas, kad tu biji viņa dzērienu devējs.

40.en: 14But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
40.lv: 14 Bet padomā par mani, kad tev labi klāsies, un rādi man laipnību, es tevi lūdzu, un piemini mani faraonam, un izved mani no šī nama:

40.en: 15For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
40.lv: 15 Jo patiešām es tiku nozagts no ebreju zemes: un šeit arī es neesmu darījis neko, lai tie mani liktu kazemātā.

40.en: 16When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
40.lv: 16 Kad galvenais maiznieks redzēja, ka tulkojums bija labs, viņš Jāzepam sacīja, Es arī biju savā sapnī, un, lūk, uz manas galvas bija trīs balti grozi:

40.en: 17And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
40.lv: 17 Un augstākajā grozā bija visa veida maiznieka izstrādājumi priekš faraona; un putni tos ēda no groza uz manas galvas.

40.en: 18And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
40.lv: 18 Un Jāzeps atbildēja un sacīja, Šis ir tā tulkojums: Trīs grozi ir trīs dienas:

40.en: 19Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
40.lv: 19 Vēl trīs dienās faraons pacels tavu galvu no tevis un tevi pakārs uz koka; un putni ēdīs tavu miesu no tevis.

40.en: 20And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
40.lv:
20

Un notika trešajā dienā, kas bija faraona dzimšanas diena, ka viņš taisīja dzīres visiem saviem kalpiem: un viņš pacēla galvenā dzērienu devēja un galvenā maiznieka galvu starp saviem kalpiem.

40.en: 21And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand:
40.lv: 21 Un viņš atjaunoja galveno dzērienu devēju atpakaļ uz viņa dzērienu došanu; un viņš deva kausu faraona rokā:

40.en: 22But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
40.lv: 22 Bet viņš pakāra galveno maiznieku: kā Jāzeps tiem bija tulkojis.

40.en: 23Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
40.lv: 23 Tomēr galvenais dzērienu devējs neatcerējās Jāzepu, bet viņu aizmirsa.

41.en: 1And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
41.lv: 1 Un notika divu pilnu gadu beigās, ka faraons sapņoja: un, lūk, viņš stāvēja pie upes.

41.en: 2And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
41.lv: 2 Un, lūk, no upes uznāca septiņas ļoti piemīlīgas un treknas miesas govis; un tās ganījās pļavā.

41.en: 3And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
41.lv: 3 Un, lūk, pēc tām no upes uznāca septiņas citas govis, nepiemīlīgas un kārnas; un nostājās pie pārējām govīm pie upes malas.

41.en: 4And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
41.lv: 4 Un nepiemīlīgās un kārnās govis apēda septiņas ļoti piemīlīgās un treknās govis. Tā faraons pamodās.

41.en: 5And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
41.lv: 5 Un viņš gulēja un sapņoja otru reizi: un, lūk, septiņas labības vārpas uznāca uz viena stiebra, kuplas un labas.

41.en: 6And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
41.lv: 6 Un, lūk, septiņas plānas vārpas un appūstas no austrumu vēja, uzdīga pēc tām.

41.en: 7And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
41.lv: 7 Un septiņas plānās vārpas aprija septiņas kuplās un pilnās vārpas. Un faraons pamodās, un, lūk, tas bija sapnis.

41.en: 8And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
41.lv: 8 Un notika no rīta, ka viņa gars bija iztrūcināts; un viņš sūtīja un aicināja pēc visiem Ēģiptes magiem un visiem tās gudrajiem: un faraons tiem stāstīja savu sapni; bet nebija neviena, kas tos varētu faraonam iztulkot.

41.en: 9Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
41.lv:
9

Tad galvenais dzērienu devējs runāja uz faraonu sacīdams, Es šajā dienā atceros savas vainas:

41.en: 10Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's house, both me and the chief baker:
41.lv: 10 Faraons bija apskaities pie saviem kalpiem un mani lika gvardes nama kapteiņa apsardzē, mani un galveno maiznieku:

41.en: 11And we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
41.lv: 11 Un mēs sapņojām sapni vienā naktī, es un viņš; mēs sapņojām katrs atbilstoši sava sapņa tulkojumam.

41.en: 12And there was there with us a young man, an Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
41.lv: 12 Un ar mums bija jauneklis, ebrejs, gvardes kapteiņa kalps; un mēs viņam stāstījām, un viņš mums iztulkoja mūsu sapņus; katram atbilstoši viņa sapnim viņš iztulkoja.

41.en: 13And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
41.lv: 13 Un notika, kā viņš mums iztulkoja, tā bija; mani viņš atjaunoja manā amatā, un viņu viņš pakāra.

41.en: 14Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto Pharaoh.
41.lv:
14

Tad faraons sūtīja un aicināja Jāzepu, un tie viņu izveda steidzīgi no kazemāta: un viņš noskuvās un pārmainīja savu tērpu, un ienāca pie faraona.

41.en: 15And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
41.lv: 15 Un faraons Jāzepam sacīja, Es esmu sapņojis sapni, un nav neviena, kas to var iztulkot: un es esmu dzirdējis par tevi, ka tu vari saprast sapni, lai to iztulkotu.

41.en: 16And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
41.lv: 16 Un Jāzeps faraonam atbildēja sacīdams, Tas nav manī: Dievs faraonam dos miera atbildi.

41.en: 17And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river:
41.lv: 17 Un faraons Jāzepam sacīja, Savā sapnī, lūk, es stāvēju uz upes krasta:

41.en: 18And, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favoured; and they fed in a meadow:
41.lv: 18 Un, lūk, no upes uznāca septiņas govis, treknas miesas un ļoti piemīlīgas; un tās ganījās pļavā:

41.en: 19And, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favoured and leanfleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
41.lv: 19 Un, lūk, septiņas citas govis uznāca pēc tām, nabagas un ļoti nepiemīlīgas, un kārnas, tādas, kā es nekad neesmu redzējis Ēģiptes zemē sliktuma dēļ:

41.en: 20And the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
41.lv: 20 Un kārnās un nepiemīlīgās govis apēda pirmās septiņas govis:

41.en: 21And when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
41.lv: 21 Un, kad tās bija tās apēdušas, to nevarēja zināt, ka tās bija tās ēdušas; bet tās joprojām bija nepiemīlīgas kā iesākumā. Tā es pamodos.

41.en: 22And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:
41.lv: 22 Un es redzēju savā sapnī, un, lūk, septiņas vārpas uznāca vienā stiebrā, pilnas un labas:

41.en: 23And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
41.lv: 23 Un, lūk, septiņas vārpas, nokaltušas, plānas un appūstas no austrumu vēja, uzdīga pēc tām:

41.en: 24And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told this unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
41.lv: 24 Un plānās vārpas aprija septiņas labās vārpas: un es šo stāstīju magiem; bet nebija neviena, kas man varētu to paziņot.

41.en: 25And Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: God hath shewed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
41.lv:
25

Un Jāzeps faraonam sacīja, Faraona sapnis ir viens: Dievs ir faraonam rādījis, ko viņš grasās darīt.
